loans.name: Gladys Eleonor

texts.es:
En la ciudadela nueva california de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal La California.
 
En este lugar conocimos a la señora Gladys tiene 48 años  de edad y  hace algunos  años su esposo falleció pero de esa  relación tiene tres hijos ya todos son mayores de edad.

Tiene un pequeño local en donde vende los deliciosos encebollados de pescado albacora, los mismos que son muy apetecidos por los habitantes del lugar. Trabaja de martes a domingos desde las 7h30 hasta las 12h00 o hasta que se termine lo que preparo. Nos cuenta que lleva 24 años con este negocio y que le ha servido mucho ya así ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia ya que ella fue padre y madre después que su esposo falleció.

Este crédito es para comprar pescado, yuca y otros ingredientes necesarios para preparar este delicioso plato. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 21 ciclos y siempre le ha gustado por la unión del grupo.  Sus sueños son tener un negocio más grande.
texts.en:
In the Nueva California zone of Portoviejo city, the capital of Manabí, known for many years as the city of the royal tamarinds, the members of La California Communal Bank meet every 15 days.

In this place we know Gladys well.  She is 48 years old.  Several years ago her husband died, leaving her with 3 children, all of whom are now adults.

Gladys has a small locale where she sells her specialty, delicious albacore cooked in onions, following an appetizing recipe much favored by local residents.  She works from Tuesday through Sundays, from 7:30 until  12:00 or when what she has prepared runs out.  She tells us that she has had this business for 24 years, and that it has served her well.  Gladys has been able to advance her family, serving as both mother and father, following the death of her husband.

This loan will be used to buy fish, yuca and other necessary ingredients for preparing this delicious dish.  Gladys has been a member of her communal bank through 21 loan cycles, and she has always liked  the group's unity.  She dreams of having a larger business.

loans.use: TO BUY FISH, YUCA AND OTHER INGREDIENTS FOR HER MEAL STALL

loans.name: Isidora Del Milagro

texts.es:
Isidora es una madre de familia de 40 años de edad que reside junto a su familia en el sector Saltur del distrito de Zaña, una zona agrícola que se encuentra ubicada a más de media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace más de cinco años a la crianza y venta de cerdos en un ambiente ubicado cerca a su domicilio, ella los alimenta de pastos naturales y alimento balanceado, cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a sus vecinos y a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona con una periodicidad determinada. Los ingresos que ella percibe de esta actividad los utiliza para ayudar a su familia a salir adelante.

Isidora desea mejorar su negocio alimentando de mejor modo a sus animales, de modo que se desarrollen de mejor modo y puedan ser vendidos a un mejor precio. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir comprando alimento balanceado.
texts.en:
Isidora is a housewife who is 40 years old. She lives with her family in the Saltur neighborhood in the district of Zaña, an agricultural area that is located a half an hour away from the city of Chiclayo. 

For over five years she has been raising and selling pigs in a location near her home. She feeds then natural pasture and a balanced feed. When they reach a good level of development she sells them to her neighbors and merchants that visit the area on a regular basis. She uses the income from this business to help her family get ahead.

Isidora wants to improve her business by feeding her animals in a better way so that they will develop better and can be sold at a better price. This is why she has thought it convenient to request a loan from field partner Edpyme Alternative in the amount of 1000 Nuevos Soles (PEN) which she will invest in purchasing a balanced feed.

loans.use: Purchase a balanced feed to obtain improvements in her business of raising and selling pigs.

loans.name: Jesús

texts.es:
Jesús es un padre de familia de 45 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y a sus dos hijos en una zona urbano – marginal del distrito de Paiján, una zona bastante comercial que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Ascope, en la región La Libertad. La localidad se encuentra situada a dos horas y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica desde hace más de cinco años a brindar servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros en una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado consistente en una motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina para brindar servicio de transporte). El brinda su servicio en las zona donde vive y en las localidades aledañas. Los ingresos que percibe los utiliza para solventar la economía de su familia y sacarlos adelante.

El excesivo uso brindado a su unidad móvil ha hecho que esta sufra algunas fallas que requieren de urgente reparación para garantizar su correcto funcionamiento. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.

Jesús ya ha tenido un crédito anterior financiado por el fondo Kiva a través de Edpyme Alternativa y su producto Capital Semilla. En aquella oportunidad también pudo reparar su mototaxi y gracias a ello pudo trabajar normalmente durante una temporada. Por ello el se encuentra agradecido con las personas que le apoyaron.
texts.en:
Jesus is a father and is 45 years old. He lives with his wife and his two children in an urban area on the outskirts of the Paijan district, a commercial area located in the Ascope province in the La Libertad region. The town is located two and a half hours away from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the region Lambayeque. 

For more than five years he has offered cargo and passenger transportation services in a motorcycle taxi (a motorized vehicle which consists of a motorcycle with a cabin attached to offer transportation services). He offers his services in the area where he lives and in the surrounding towns. He uses the income he receives to pay for his family's expenses and to get them ahead. 

The excessive use of his motorcycle taxi has resulted in its suffering some failures that need urgent repair to guarantee its proper function. This is why he thought it appropriate to request a loan from field partner Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1500 Nuevos Soles (PEN). 

Jesus has previously had a loan funded by Kiva through field partner Edpyme Alternative and Capital Semilla. On that occasion, he was also able to repair his motorcycle taxi and thanks to that he was able to work regularly for a while. This is why he is thankful to those people that helped him.

loans.use: Expenses for repair and maintenance of a motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: María Andrómeda

texts.es:
María Andrómeda tiene 50 años de edad, es soltera y reside junto a su familia en el distrito de Las Lomas, una zona agrícola que se encuentra ubicada en la región Piura, a más de tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la comercialización de cosméticos por catálogo, ella cuenta con una clientela fija que siempre le está solicitando pedidos, aun así ella siempre trata de captar más clientes y más pedidos ya que la empresa que le provee de productos le paga de acuerdo a la cantidad de pedidos que realiza. Adicionalmente cuenta con una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio. Con los ingresos que ella obtiene de esta actividad se encarga de solventar la economía de su familia.

María Andrómeda desea contar con un capital estable para adquirir mas productos y contar con un stock fijo de cosméticos, esto permitirá a sus clientes adquirir los productos que necesitan rápidamente sin tener que esperar hasta fin de mes, que es cuando le entregan los pedidos. Para lograr su objetivo ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a conseguir su meta.
texts.en:
Maria Andromeda is 50 years old. She is single and lives with her family in the Las Lomas district, an agricultural area that is located in the Piura region, more than three hours away from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. 

Maria sells cosmetics through a catalog. She has regular customers that are always placing orders. Even so, she always tries to attract more customers and more orders because the company that provides the products pays her according to the quantity of orders she places. In addition, she also counts on a small cellar that she has in her home. With the income she obtains from this work she is able to provide for the family's expenses. 

Maria Andromeda wants to rely on stable capital to buy more products and be able to count on a fixed stock of cosmetics. This will allow her clients to acquire the products they need quickly without having to wait until the end of the month which is when her orders are delivered. To achieve her goal she has requested a loan from field partner Edpyme Alternative in the amount of 1000 Nuevos Soles (PEN) which will help her obtain her goal.

loans.use: Purchase cosmetics to expand her business.

loans.name: Selenita Maribel

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Nueva Portoviejo de la  ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Nueva Portoviejo.
 
La señora Selenita es socia del Banco Comunal desde hace dos años  y está muy contenta,  le encanta las reuniones porque aprende cosas nuevas y en ellas ha hecho muchas nuevas amistades. Tiene 41 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre  y fruto de esta relación tiene seis hijos, dos de ellos mayores y 4 de 16, 15,  13 y un pequeñito de dos meses, tres de sus hijos están en colegio. Su marido trabaja en el Municipio de Portoviejo.

Se dedica al comercio, vende juguetes y bisutería, ella se desplaza de pueblo en pueblo cuando hay ferias o fiestas, en estas ciudades se queda mientras duren las fiestas,  para esto organiza un local en el cual expende sus productos, nos cuenta que a veces se queda hasta por siete días seguidos en los lugares donde ella va. Lleva en este negocio ya 12 años y le gusta esta labor ya que así conoce muchos lugares de la provincia.

Este crédito es para comprar bisutería y juguetes. Su sueño es tener un bazar en su casa para vender sus productos.
texts.en:
Every fortnight the members of the 'Nueva Portoviejo' community bank meet in the Nueva Portoviejo district of the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, which has been known for many years as the city of the royal tamarind trees.

Selenita has been a member of the community bank for two years and she is very happy.  She really enjoys the meetings because she learns new things and she has made a lot of new friends there.  Selenita is 41 years old and has a common-law husband.  She has six children from this relationship.  Two of her children are already grown up and the others are 16, 15, 13 and a little one who is just two months old.  Three of her children are in school.  Her husband works for the City of Portoviejo.

Selenita sells toys and costume jewelry.  She travels from town to town whenever there are festivals or fiestas.  She stays in the towns while the fiestas last and arranges a place where she can sell her products.  She tells us that sometimes she stays for up to seven days straight in these places.  She has been in this business for 12 years and she likes her work because through it she gets to know many places in the province.

Selenita will use this loan to buy costume jewelry and toys.  Her dream is to have a store in her home where she can sell her products.

loans.use: To buy costume jewlry and toys

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca N. is from the village of San Vicente, Tambulig, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 44 years old. Francisca is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Francisca owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Francisca has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Francisca joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Francisca is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. This will be the first loan taken out by Francisca from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Julio Alejandro

texts.en:
Julio is thirty-nine years old.  He lives in the district of Las Lomas in the province of Piura.  The region is which he lives is semi-tropical and is primarily populated by smaller farmers.  Julio has no children and lives in his own home.

Julio his a farmer.  On property near his home Julio raises goats.  He has a herd of fifty head.  Julio also has a small plot of land which he inherited from his father on which he raises various crops.  When Julio is not in the fields, he works for a local factory earning a stable income.  Julio is well respected as a hard worker and stable member of the community.

This will be Julio’s first loan from Edpyme Alternativa.  He plans to use the loan funds to purchase additional feed for his animals and expand his herd.  He hopes to be able to make better use of the land he has and improve his production in order to become more independent and earn greater income on his own.  Julio dreams of owning a larger farm and building a stable base for the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional feed for his animals and expand his herd

loans.name: Marysol

texts.es:
Marysol tiene 48 años de edad, es madre soltera y reside en el distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona situada en la región Piura a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque

Ella cuenta con una bodega instalada en su vivienda, allí ella ofrece a sus clientes productos de uso diario, entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. Su clientela prefiere su negocio porque ella siempre brinda productos de calidad y un buen trato. El negocio le sirve para solventar la economía de su hogar.

Marysol desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo más productos de modo que pueda satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Marysol is 48 years old.  She is a single mother and lives in the agricultural district of Tambogrande, an area which is located in Piura region, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of Lambayeque region.

Marysol has a small grocery store in her home.  She offers her customers essentials and groceries.  Her customers prefer her business because she always offers quality products and provides a good service.  Her business helps her household financially.

Marysol would like to expand her business, acquiring more products so that she can satisfy her customers' demands.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan for 1,500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To buy products to expand her grocery store which is located in her home

loans.name: María Genara

texts.en:
Maria is fifty-nine years old.  She lives in the district of Las Lomas in the province of Piura.  It is a semi-tropical region populated by small farmers and ranchers.  There are many small fruit plantations alongside cattle and goats.  Maria is a single mother.  She owns her own home and shares it with her daughter.

Out of her home, Maria operates a small general store.  She sells basic items to her neighbors, greatly reducing the time it takes for them to complete their shopping journeys.  Maria sells soap, foods, dry goods and other items.  Maria has the help of her daughter in the daily operations and has a good number of loyal customers.  She is proud to provide for her family and neighbors in an independent manner.

This will be Maria’s first loan with Edpyme Alternativa.  She plans to use the loan proceeds to expand her merchandise and better meet the demand of her clients.  She hopes to be able to obtain bulk discounts.  Maria dreams of expanding her business and making various improvements to her home.  She also hopes to be able to assist her daughter in her education.

loans.use: To expand her merchandise and better meet the demand of her customers

loans.name: Soraya Margarita

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Nueva Portoviejo de la  ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Nueva Portoviejo.
 
En este lugar encontramos a la señora Soraya, ella tiene 35 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene tres hijos de 17,  15 y 8 años,  dos de ellos estan en colegio y el menor en escuela.  Su esposo es albañil.

Es una ama de casa que también se dedica al comercio, vende ropa y zapatos por catálogo de la marca Nive, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta,  también vende productos de la marca Avon y Sayson (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería, y accesorios para damas) ventas que realiza al mismo tiempo que hace la venta de ropa. Trabaja todos los  días, deja a crédito y cobra los fines de semana. Su mercadería la recibe en una distribuidora en Portoviejo.

Este crédito es para comprar ropa, cremas, perfumes y bisutería. Lleva 7 años en el  Banco Comunal y le ha gustado el banco por la rapidez para conseguir los créditos, ella se desempeña como secretaria del Banco. Sus sueños son tener un bazar en su casa y que sus hijos sean buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Every fortnight the members of the 'Nueva Portoviejo' community bank meet in the Nueva Portoviejo district of the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, which has been known for many years as the city of the royal tamarind trees.

Here we meet 35 year-old Soraya.  Soraya is married and has three children aged 17, 15 and 8.  Two of her children are in high school and the youngest is in elementary school.  Her husband is a construction worker.

Soraya is a housewife who also sells Nive-brand clothes and shoes through a catalog.  She makes her sales door to door.  She also sells Avon and Sayson products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes and ladies' accessories).  She makes these sales at the same time she makes her clothes sales.  She works every day, leaving her products with her customers on credit and collecting payment on the weekend.  She receives her merchandise from a supplier in Portoviejo.

Soraya will use this loan to buy clothes, creams, perfume and costume jewelry.  She has been a member of her community bank for 7 years and she likes it for the speed with which she can acquire loans.  She is her community bank's secretary.  Soraya's dreams are to have a store in her home and for her children to become good professionals.

loans.use: To buy clothes, creams, perfume and costume jewelry

loans.name: Glecerio

texts.en:
Glecerio S. is from the village of Lubid, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. He is 46 years old. Glecerio is married. To make a living, Glecerio owns & operates a general store store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Glecerio is just starting this business.

In 2008, Glecerio joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Glecerio has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC.  Glecerio is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the second loan taken out by Glecerio from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane E. is from the village of Acad, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 26 years old. Jane is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Jane owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Jane is just starting this business.

In 2008, Jane joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jane has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. Jane is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This will be the third loan taken out by Jane from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Yadira Graciela

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Nueva Portoviejo de la  ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Nueva Portoviejo.
 
Encontramos a la señora Yadira, tiene 31 años de edad, está casada y tiene dos hijos  de cuatro y dos años que son la luz de su vida comenta. Ella participo en un concurso de alta costura a nivel provincial en este año en el que logro el primer lugar.
 
Tiene un pequeño taller de costura donde desde hace muchos años se dedica a coser ropa de todo tipo de ropa (vestidos quinceañeras, de novias, y otras). Pero dice que le encanta hacer ropa para niños, trabaja a base de pedidos de personas particulares y también elabora ropa para un almacén en el centro de la ciudad, trabaja con la ayuda de una persona a la cual le paga un sueldo mensual.

Está en el Banco Comunal cuatro años y está muy contenta ya que le han ayudado mucho. Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar para comprar telas y otros materiales para la costura. Sus sueños son tener un taller más grande y un almacén en el centro de la ciudad donde también pueda vender sus obras.
texts.en:
Every fortnight the members of the 'Nueva Portoviejo' community bank meet in the Nueva Portoviejo district of the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, which has been known for many years as the city of the royal tamarind trees.

Here we meet 31 year-old Yadira who is married and has two children, aged 4 and 2, who are the light of her life.  Yadira competed in a haute couture competition at province level this year and she won first place.

Yadira has a small dressmaking workshop where she has been sewing all kinds of clothes (15th birthday dresses, bridal gowns, etc.) for many years.  However, she says that she loves making children's clothes.  She works on orders from individuals and also makes clothes for a store in the city center.  She works with the help of another person who she pays a monthly salary.

Yadira has been a member of her community bank for four years and she is very happy because it has helped her a lot.  She will use this new loan to buy fabric and other materials for her dressmaking business.  Her dreams are to have a bigger workshop in the city center where she can also sell her clothes.

loans.use: To buy fabric, thread, zippers, buttons, etc.

loans.name: Feliz Santiago

texts.es:
Feliz Santiago de 25 años de edad, vive en la Ciudad de Nueva Guinea de la Casa de la Cultura 1/2 c. al norte;  este joven aún no ha formado su propio hogar no tiene ninguna responsabilidad familiar solamente sus gastos de estudios universitarios, apesar de ser soltero es muy responsable con su mamà ya que la ayuda con todo lo que ella necesita, labora como docente de primaria desde hace nueve años de donde obtiene sus ingresos mensuales. 

Solicita su tercer crèdito que con el apoyo de Kiva pretende comprar materiales de construcciòn lo cual este joven es muy creativo y organizado con sus gastos ya que ha ido comprando poco a poco los materiales para cuando tenga la mayor parte poder comenzar a construir su  vivienda.  

Su sueño es llegar a formar una Familia y tener un hogar propio donde habitar.
texts.en:
Feliz Santiago is 25 years old.  He lives in the city of Nueva Guinea, in the Casa de la Cultura ½ c. North section.  This young man still hasn't set up his own household.  He doesn't have any family responsibilities.  He only has to cover his university expenses.  Although he is single, he is very responsible towards his mom and helps her with everything she needs.  He has been working as an elementary school teacher for 9 years which is how he earns his monthly income.

Feliz Santiago is requesting his third loan.  With Kiva's support he plans to buy building materials.  This young man is very creative and organized with his expenses.  He has been buying building materials bit by bit.  When he has most of the material together he will start building his home.

His dream is to have a family and his own home to live in.

loans.use: To buy building materials

loans.name: 64- Thôn 2 - Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Nga P. Thị (88) is a 19-year-old woman living in the town of Thanh Hoá.  Nga is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 64 - Thôn 2- Quảng Hưng (18.02.64 Quảng Hưng).


Nga is single and does not have any children.  To make a living, Nga owns & operates a specialized retail store.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling animal feed & farm-related products in the local community.  Nga has been engaged in this business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2010, Nga joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Nga is requesting for the first time a loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women in the amount of 4,248,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  This will be the 1st loan taken out by Nga from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Nga plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  N. Thị Cương (86) is a 36-year-old woman who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


2.  P. Thị Gấm (87) is a 35-year-old woman who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


3.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: 42 - Đông Lân 2- Dien Bien Group

texts.en:
Hanh C. T. (204) is a 51-year-old woman living in the town of Thanh Hoa.  Hanh is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 42 - Đông Lân 2- Dien Bien (03.03.42 Dien Bien).

Hanh is married and has 2 adult children.  To make a living, Hanh owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating a service-based business.  WhiL. not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing general services to local community members.  Hanh has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2009, Hanh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Hanh C. T. (204) là 51 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoa.  Hanh là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 42 - Đông Lân 2- Dien Bien (03.03.42 Dien Bien).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ cung cấp các dịch vụ nói chung cho người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Hanh thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Hanh kiếm được khoảng 3.000.000 VND.  Vào 2009, Hanh đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Hanh đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 0,000 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng đầu tư mở rộng công việc kinh doanh.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 4.248.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

2.  N. T. K. Chung (203) là 21 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh dịch vụ cho thuê phòng trọ.


3.  Phan T. Hong (205) là 36 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma B. is from the village of Bernard Sub. Aguada, Ozamiz City. She is 38 years old. Gemma is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Gemma owns and operates two businesses: a sari-sari (variety) store and a rent-a-car business. She has been engaged in her businesses for over 13 months and earns approximately 35,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Gemma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is now requesting a loan of 40,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for her business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

 About PMPC:

 Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for her existing businesses

loans.name: Doria

texts.en:
Doria B. is from the city of Maquilao Tangub City. She is 29 years old. Doria is married and has 3 young children. To make a living, Doria owns & operates transportation business. Doria has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Doria joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Doria is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to repair her existing vehicle to provide better transportation services. This will be the first loan taken out by Doria from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana A. is from the village of Commonwealth, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 61 years old. Juana is married. To make a living, Juana owns & operates a business raising pigs for sale. Juana is just starting this business.

In 2009, Juana joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Juana has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. Juana is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will again be used to purchase breeding livestock. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Juana from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Adela

texts.en:
Adela J. is from the village of Kinangay Norte Clarin Misamis Occidental. She is 47 years old. Adela is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Adela owns & operates a transportation services business. Adela has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Adela joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Adela has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 13000 PHP which will be used to repair her existing vehicle to provide better service. This will be the 21st loan taken out by Adela from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is 50 years old and is married to Norberto. This couple has two children, both of whom are dependent upon their parents. The children are aged 13 years old and 11 years old. Nelly and her husband work hard but their income is very small and they didn't even have capital to start up a business. 

In 2003, Nelly heard about ASHI. Her dream of having a stable life with a stable house and to start a business became possible. When she received her first and succeeding loans from ASHI, Nelly started her own business of a fruit stall in the local community. It has been a few long years now that she has had this kind of business. The fruit stall has been a great help to her family. As a busy entrepreneur, Nelly also embarked on a tricycle (motorcycle with sidecar) transport business. Her husband manages this business.

However, the demands of her family grows as the years go by. So, she now aspires to have another business that can add to her present income in order to have bigger profits and more savings. She came up with the idea of operating sari-sari (variety) store. It has been a great success! Nelly earned a good income and she wants to have more investment in the sari-sari store. For her 12th loan, she is proposing a new loan amounting to PHP 40,000.00 to expand her three ventures. The loan fund will specifically be used to purchase an inventory of groceries for her store, more stock of fruits to sell, and support the maintenance of their tricycle. 

With this kind of business, Nelly can still manage her previous fruit stall business because either she or her husband can operate their sari-sari (variety) store at home. Someday, as her income increases, she dreams of funding her children’s education until they each complete a college degree and have professional jobs in the future. Her greatest dreams are of lifting her family out of poverty and to have happy living.

loans.use: To purchase inventory of groceries for her store, more stock of fruits to sell, and to support the maintenance of their tricycle.

loans.name: Mereke

texts.en:
Mereke H. is 32 years old and lives with her husband in the Bayan-Ulgii province of western Mongolia.  She and her family live together in a rented house.  

Mereke and her husband operate a clothing and consumer goods retail business in their town.  They began their business in 2008 after moving to their current town.  Within a short period, they have built a stable and successful operation and today their working capital has exceeded 1,500,000 MNT.  They plan to buy and warehouse a large amount of products before the new year holiday when borders of Mongolian and China are both closed. 

Mereke says, " All I want is to have our own house where my husband and I can live comfortably."  She is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan in order to purchase more products from China in order to increase her sales.

loans.use: To purchase more products from China in order to increase her sales.

loans.name: 10.15.05 Group

texts.en:
Xuan H. T. (55) is a 31 year-old femaL. living in the town of Thanh hoa. Xuan is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 05 Dong Son (10.15.05).

Xuan is married and has 2 school-aged children. To making a living, Xuan operates a family member's specialized retail store, primarily selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community.  Xuan has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2008, Xuan joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Xuan has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,079,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. She is now requesting a new loan of 3,079,800 VND which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Xuan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Xuan plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  H. T. Huyen (53) is a 33 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her clothing business.

2.  D. T. Hang (54) is a 36 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business of making & selling food.

3.  L. T. Duy (270) is a 26 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her specialized retail store.

4.  L. T. H. Hanh (46) is a 28 year-old femaL. who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her service-based business.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:
The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

Xuan H. T. (55) là 31 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh hoa.  Xuan là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 05 Dong Son (10.15.05).

Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các mặt hàng nhu yếu phẩm như dầu gội đầu, xà bông & kem đánh răng trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Xuan thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Xuan kiếm được khoảng 3000000 VND.  Vào 2008, Xuan đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Xuan đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3,079,800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các sản phẩm bổ sung để bán.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 3,079,800 VND.

Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina M. is 34-years old, married and supports her family by operating 2 business ventures: fishing and fish vending. She lives in Malocbaloc, Barangay Agujo, Daanbantayan, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2009 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her fishing and fish vending businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 9000. 

Gina is now borrowing PHP 12,000 so that she can purchase fishing gear and equipment. This will be her 3rd loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 7000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Gina aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and to ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase of fishing gear and equipment.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda D. is from the village of Silucap Liloy Zamboanga Del Norte. She is 38 years old. Merlinda is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Merlinda owns & operates a business making & selling rice products in the local community. Merlinda has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Merlinda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Merlinda is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Merlinda from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda P. is from the village of Baybay liloy Zamboanga del norte. She is 43 years old. Luzminda is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Luzminda owns & operates a business selling peanuts in the local community. Luzminda has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Luzminda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Luzminda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Luzminda is requesting a new loan of 30000 PHP which will again be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Luzminda from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Tenocra

texts.en:
Tenocra Y. is a married woman who lives in Barangay Malis, Brooke's Point, Palawan. She earns her living by operating two business ventures:  a general store and copra (dried coconut meat). Her husband Alvin Y., who is 31 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have one child who is 1 year old. 

Tenocra joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 12 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Tenocra has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 29,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 18,000, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 13th loan, she is borrowing PHP 29,500, with which she intends to buy inventory of general store products so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her only child. She also hopes that it will improve her business. Tenocra Y. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Gracelyn

texts.en:
Gracelyn G. is 35 years old, married and has one school-aged child.  She is from the village of Calaran, Calamba.  Gracelyn runs a grocery store. Out of this activity, she is able to earn a monthly net income of 4,000 PHP.  She has been operating her business for more than 10 years. 

In 2005, Gracelyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gracelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business.  Gracelyn is requesting her 11th loan of 35,000 PHP which will be used to purchase a parcel of land.  

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a parcel of land.

loans.name: Venis

texts.en:
Venis J. has enjoyed spending the profits from her vegetable farming business and sari-sari store ventures.  “Sari” means variety in the native dialect. A sari-sari store basically sells several types of food stuffs, beverages and household necessities.  The store is either operated from the owner’s house or a small cottage not far away from the owner’s home.

Because of her two ventures she has able to sustain the needs of her family and has been able to improve their lives.  With that, Venis is encouraged to work harder and plan further for her business and family.  Because she has her own business that supports their financial needs she can access loans to support her business. 

Therefore, Venis wants to take this opportunity to grow her businesses by requesting another loan of 35,000 PHP from our Kiva lenders for use as additional business capital.  Venis wants to maintain and support the needs of her farming business to grow more vegetables to sell and sustain the operation of her sari-sari (variety) store.

Her long term goals are to have a successful vegetable farming business, a full-fledge grocery store and to support her family financially. 

With the support of Kiva lenders, she is determined to achieve business success with her new entrepreneurial endeavor.  Venis’s wish is to offer her children hope for a better future and that is what fuels her pledge to her business endeavor.

Venis is very happy to be a Kiva borrower and says thank you for offering financial support for her business dreams.

loans.use: Additional business capital for her vegetable farm and sari-sari store.

loans.name: Merlinda's Group

texts.en:
Merlinda D. is from the village of Lusot, Baliangao.  She is 37 years old.  Merlinda is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Merlinda is married and has 7 school-aged children.  To make a living, Merlinda owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector growing rice for sale.  She has been engaged in her business for over 17 years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Merlinda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase farm supplies.  Merlinda is requesting her 14th loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used for educational purposes. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For educational purposes

loans.name: Tilegen

texts.en:
Tilegen S. is 44 years old and lives with his wife and three daughters in Bayan-Ulgii province of Mongolia.  He and his family all live together in their ger /Mongolian nomadic housing tent/.  All of his daughters attend a local secondary school. 

Tilegen owns his own car and is a taxi driver in his town.  He began his business in 2005 and has gained a lot of business experience over the years.  His earnings have enabled him to improve his old car.  His daily business income is between 15,000 and 20,000 MNT, of which 10,000 and 12,000 MNT is his net profit.  His car consumes 7 liters of petrol for every 100 km.  By operating his business, he is able to provide for his family.  He is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan as working capital for his business.

loans.use: Working capital for his business.

loans.name: Luvsantseren

texts.en:
Luvsantseren C. is 33 years old and lives with his wife and two daughters in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.  He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, in one of the ger districts on the outskirts of the large city. 

Both of his two children are in kindergarten.  Luvsantseren operates a micro bus transportation service with help of his wife and takes passengers from one side of Ulaanbaatar to the other.  He began his business in 2008 after working as a conductor in the mini bus for several years.  Starting this year, they started to transport people between local towns and the city.  For the future, Luvsantseren says, " I want to buy a new car so that I can reduce my operating cost."  He is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan in order to pay for half the cost of the car.

loans.use: To pay half of the cost of the car.

loans.name: Nazgul

texts.en:
Nazgul D. is 38 years old and lives with her husband and four children in Bayan-Ulgii province in western Mongolia.  She and her family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent.  Her four children all attend a local school and her husband works as an assistant accountant at the local power station.  

Nazgul owns and operates a bakery production business in her town.  She signed a contract with two local schools to provide lunch for the elementary school pupils.  Today her working capital exceeds 1,000,000 MNT and her monthly net profit is approximately 800,000 MNT.  After a short period of operation, she has gained much experience as both a businesswoman and a cook. 

In the future, she plans to expand her business by opening her own grocery and bakery shop.  Nazgul is requesting a 1,600,000 MNT loan to purchase a bread cutter and other necessary tools and equipments for her meal producing business.

loans.use: To purchase bread cutter and other necessary tools and equipment.

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
Millicent is a married woman with two children, all of whom attend school.  She lives in a rental that has electricity and piped water.  Her greatest monthly expenses are food and clothing.

She has operated a poultry business for over two years and she sells in a shop and from home to her neighbours and passersby.  In addition she operates a boutique business which is her other source of income.  Millicent faces a major challenge of seasonality and high cost of transportation in her business.  She hopes to expand her boutique in the future.

With the 60,000 KES loan she wants to purchase 200 chicks, chicken feed and chicken medicine.  She decided to join Yehu to get loans to improve her business and her standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase 200 chicks, chicken feed and chicken medicine.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen has been in the farming business for twelve years now. She is a farmer from the town of Kitale in western Kenya. Her farm produces milk, vegetables and eggs which she sells to the local market. 

She has requested this loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. The extra income from the sale of milk will help improve the living standards of her family. Her primary challenge in farming has been lack of storage facilities for her dairy feed during the dry seasons. She hopes that in the next five years, she will have acquired 6 more dairy cows and be the major supplier of milk to the Kenya Cooperative Creameries.

Hellen is 66 years old and married with 8 children who are all adults, two of whom attend school.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Ngombe

texts.en:
Ngombe, a married woman with two children, all of whom attend school, owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Ngombe has operated a charcoal-selling business for the past six years; she sells as retail and from home to her neighbors and passersby. Ngombe faces the major challenge of high transportation costs in her business. She hopes to expand and sell as wholesale in the future.

Having decided to join Yehu to access loans and improve her business, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale with a loan of Kshs 30,000.

loans.use: To  purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Lydiah

texts.en:
Lydiah has a mixed farm in Kitale town, western Kenya that produces maize, milk and beans. She has been farming for the last twenty years and employs one farmhand. She also owns a posho mill which supplements her income. 

Lydiah is 49 years old and married with 4 adult children, one of whom attends school.

She has requested this loan of 30,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to start a poultry project. The income obtained from the project will help her pay school fees for her child. She says that poultry diseases are sometimes common and when they strike, huge losses are incurred. She hopes that in future, she will be able to supply poultry to the local hotels in the area and be the major supplier of eggs in her area.

loans.use: To start a poultry project.

loans.name: Said

texts.en:
Said is a married man with two children, one of whom attends school while the other one is still too young for school.  He owns a house that has piped water but no electricity.  His greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

He has operated a video show room and phone battery charging business for the last eight months.  In addition he operates a retail shop that is his other source of income.  Said faces a major challenge of seasonality.  During the months of January and February the business is slow.  He hopes to expand into the motorcycle transport business in the future. 

With the 80,000 KES loan, he wants to purchase a boda boda (motorcycle) and start a motorcycle transport business. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve his business.

loans.use: To purchase a boda boda (motorcycle) and start a motorcycle transport business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene operates a frozen food business. She started this business only when ASHI gave her an opportunity to obtain a loan. The proceeds of her business give her extra money to support the immediate and basic needs of her family.  They also allow her to set aside savings for the future.

Arlene is requesting a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy more frozen foods to sell. She hopes that her business will become successful someday. She also wishes to engage in more businesses that will provide her family with additional income to supplement husband’s earnings. Along with the business success she dreams about is a desire to see her three children graduate from college and find great jobs. 
 
Arlene wants to thank ASHI & Kiva lenders who are supporting this loan. This is a great chance for her to begin reaching her goals.

loans.use: to buy frozen food products to sell

loans.name: Regie

texts.en:
Regie J. is 27 years old, married and has two children, one is school-aged and the other one is infant aged. She is from the village of Southwestern Poblacion, Calamba. Regie is engaged in running a grocery store. Out of this activity she's able to earn a monthly net income of PHP 3,200. She has been operating her business for more than 4 years.

In 2009, Regie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Regie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Regie is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP, which will be used for medical purposes. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Regie from PMPC. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For medical purposes.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony is twenty-eight years old and married with one 18 month old child. He is a farmer from the town of Kitale in western Kenya where he has been farming for 6 years. His farm produces milk, maize, beans, vegetables and potatoes which he sells to the local market. He mainly depends on the income from his farming to cater for the needs of his family.

He has requested this loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says that the extra income from this loan will help him take care of the basic needs of his family and also invest in other businesses. Fluctuations in the market prices of farm produce and diseases which are too costly to treat have been his biggest challenges. In the future, he plans to venture into zero grazing and improve his milk production.

He hopes that Juhudi will continue funding farmers in order to improve their standards of living.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia A. is engaged in farming, specifically in producing corn, as her main source of income. She has been operating her business for five years and earn a monthly net income of 3,000 PHP. Letecia is 55 years old, married and has four adult children. She is from the village of Napilan, Sapang Dalaga.

In 2008, Letecia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Letecia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC. Letecia is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP, which will be used for corn production. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Letecia from PMPC. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.name: Avelita

texts.en:
Avelita V. is engaged in selling assorted handicrafts (such as native baskets, fans, etc.). She has been in her business for more than 10 years and earns a monthly net income of 4000 PHP. Avelita is 65 years old, married and blessed with two school-aged children. She is from the village of D'ban, Calamba.
 
In 2003, Avelita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Avelita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Avelita is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP, which will be used to purchase new stocks for the store to sell. This loan will be the 6th loan taken out by Avelita from PMPC.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila E. is from the village of Sibutad. She is 31 years old, married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Mila owns and operates a food stall. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling viand (cooked meats) and other delicacies in the local community. Mila has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Mila joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mila has successfully repaid a previous loan of 650 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used for personal purposes. Mila is requesting her 4th loan of 14,900 PHP, which will be used to invest for the expansion of her business. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: To invest in the expansion of her business.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia M. is from the village of Magcamiguing, Calamba. She is 56 years old, married and has 6 children, 5 of them are adults and only one is school-aged. To make a living, Alicia owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector planting assorted crops to sell. Alicia has been engaged in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 2,300 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2004, Alicia joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alicia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Alicia is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP, which will be used for educational purposes. This loan will be the 11th loan taken out by Alicia from PMPC. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.
