Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For educational purposes.

loans.name: Eliza's Group

texts.en:
Eliza C. is from the village of Bagakay, Sibutad. She is 35 years old. Eliza is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Eliza is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Eliza owns and operates a business venture in the food sector producing rice to sell. Eliza has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Eliza joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Eliza has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase pesticides for the farm. Eliza is requesting her 6th loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used as additional capital for rice production. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For rice production.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is a single woman with one child who attends school. She owns a house that has piped water but not electricity. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

She has operated a retail shop business for the past five years, selling to her neighbors and passersby. In addition, she sells doughnuts which contributes to her other source of income. Mwanajuma faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

With the Kshs 15,000 she wants to purchase stock of sugar, wheat flour, maize flour and rice. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase stock of sugar, wheat flour, maize flour and rice.

loans.name: Celeste

texts.en:
Celeste C. is from the village of Pta. Sulong, Baliangao. She is 42 years old, married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Celeste owns and operates a business venture in the food sector specifically in buying and selling of ocean-caught fish. Celeste has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Celeste joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Celeste has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,820 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase one sack of rice for own consumption. Celeste is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP, which will be used as additional capital for her business. This loan will be the 18th loan taken out by Celeste from PMPC. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for the business.

loans.name: Henry Cheruiyot

texts.en:
Henry Cheruiyot B. is 29 years old, married to Mary Cheruiyot who is a business lady and this also is a source of additional income for the family. They have two children going to school aged three and two years old, their residence is in Eldoret-Kenya. He is selling milk and has been in this business for three years and earns a monthly profit of KES.8, 000.

Henry learned about KADET LTD through marketing awareness done in the area and is applying for the first loan of KES 10,000 from KADET LTD, which he intends to buy one cow.  He plans to use to the profits to expand on his Milk business.

In future Henry wishes to have a dairy farm. His deeper desire is to see his children realizing their goals in life through better education.

loans.use: To buy one cow.

loans.name: Philip Waruingi

texts.en:
Philip has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru for the last four years. He is 53 years old, married to Rebecca Gathoni. They are blessed with a 15 year old daughter, who is a student.

He got to know about KADET through various marketing activities carried out by the KADET staff in Ndunyu Njeru. This will be his fifth loan. He paid his previous loan of KES 80,000 in full and on time. He plans to use the loan amount to buy farm inputs, fertilizers, seedlings, land preparation and to boost his hardware stock.

In the future, Philip hopes to increase farm production by practicing large-scale farming.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs, fertilizers, seedlings, land preparation and also boost his hardware stock.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda C. is from the village of Rizal,Jimenez,Misamis Occidental. She is 46 years old. Linda is married. To make a living, Linda owns and operates a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling fish in the market. Linda has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Linda joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Linda is requesting a new loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Linda from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To expand his poultry farm.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a married woman with five children, one of whom attends school while four graduated. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

She has operated an ice making business for the past five years, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. In addition, she operates a phone battery charging business which contributes to her other source of income. Alice hopes to expand her business in the future.

With the Kshs 70,000 she wants to purchase a freezer for storing ice for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase a freezer for storing ice for sale.

loans.name: Shiela

texts.en:
Shiela B. is from the village of Tabo-o,Jimenez,Misamis Occidental. She is 27 years old. Shiela is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Shiela owns and operates a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling fish to the local community members. Shiela has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Shiela joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Shiela has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to additional capital for her business. Shiela is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Shiela from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Verginia

texts.en:
Verginia is 28 years old single and resides in Binangonan, which is located in the Province of Rizal. She has a store in her house where she sells basic necessities and all types of products that people use in their homes. She is requesting a loan so that she can have the funds needed to buy more food products and basic household necessities. This will allow her to attract more customers and gain greater revenue. 

Verginia’s dream is to have a fully fledged expanded sari-sari (variety) store business.  She has shown herself to be hard-working and strong-minded to make her dreams come true and hopes that her business will continue to be more productive and improve her overall quality of living, lifting her out of poverty.

Verginia is very happy to be a Kiva borrower and says thank you for offering financial support to her business efforts.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs and basic household necessities.

loans.name: John Maina

texts.en:
John has been in the butchery business for the last three years. He is 29 years old and married to Lucy Wayiku. They have one child.

This is John’s third loan from KADET. He was introduced to KADET by a friend who is also a KADET client. He paid his previous loan of KES 26,000 in full and on time. With this loan he intends to improve and expand his business to accommodate a dining area and increase his stock of meat.

His dream and aspiration is to own a chain of butcheries in Niavasha.

loans.use: To improve and expand his business to accommodate a dinning area and increase his stock of meat.

loans.name: Constance

texts.en:
Constance is a married woman with one child who attends school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

She has operated a tailoring business for the past seven years; her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. Constance faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to expand and open another tailoring shop in the future. 

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase a bundle of cloth materials for her tailoring business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase a bundle of cloth materials for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Trương

texts.en:
T. Trương Thị T. (20209050047) is a 30 year-old female living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  She is married and has 2 school-aged children.  To making a living, T. owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising chickens for sale.  T. has been engaged in this business for over 6 years and earns approximately 3.200.000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2008, T. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  T. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5.600.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.  T. is now requesting a new loan of 8.288.000 VND which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies.  The loan will be the 4th loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  T. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand the borrower's business.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


T. Trương Thị T. (20209050047) là 30 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 2 trẻ ở độ tuổi đi học.  Để kiếm sống, T. Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi gà để bán.  T. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 6 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, T. kiếm được khoảng 3.200.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2008, T. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  T. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 8.288.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để mua thức ăn gia súc & các loại cung cấp khác.  Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  T. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung T. hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Nguyễn

texts.en:
Sử Nguyễn Thị (20209050044) is a 57 year-old female living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  She is married and has 4 adult children.  To make a living, Sử owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a clothing business.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing general clothing services to local community members.  Sử has been engaged in this business for over 13 years and earns approximately 2.800.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2008, Sử joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Sử has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5.600.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital.  Sử is now requesting a new loan of 8.288.000 VND which will be used to invest in renovating the business.  The loan will be the 4th loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  Sử plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve/expand the borrower's business.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Sử Nguyễn Thị (20209050044) là 57 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 4 trẻ ở độ tuổi trưởng thành.  Để kiếm sống, Sử Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh quần áo.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ cung cấp các dịch vụ quần áo thông thường cho người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Sử thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 13 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Sử kiếm được khoảng 2.800.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2008, Sử đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Sử đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua thêm hàng hóa tồn kho & vốn lưu động.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 8.288.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để đầu tư đổi mới công việc kinh doanh.  Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  Sử dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn thu nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: to invest in renovating the business

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food and electricity bills.

For the past ten years, she has been running a school whereby the neighboring children are her potential customers. In addition she operates a Kikoi sales business which contributes to her other source of income. Beatrice faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to expand her school in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase bundles of Kikois for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of Kikois (wraps) for resale.

loans.name: Gertrude

texts.en:
Gertrude M. lives in the Ndeeba neighborhood of the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 6 children, all of whom are in school.  She also takes care of an additional family member (orphan).

Gertrude has a business of tailoring. She has been in this business for 6 years, and she works 6 days out of every week. Gertrude sells her products in a shop, by means of retail. Gertrude has requested for a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more rolls of African attire and clothing materials. She also generates additional income through bridal dresses.

The main business challenge(s) for Gertrude include seasonality and defaulters. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a bridal shop.   Gertrude lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more rolls of African attire and clothing materials.

loans.name: Ngô

texts.en:
C. Ngô Thị (20209050043) is a 54-year-old female living in the town of huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh..  She is married and has 3 adult -children.  To making a living, C. owns & operates a specialized retail store.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling liquor such as beer & wine in the local community.  C. has been engaged in this business for over 11 years and earns approximately 3.600.000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2008, C. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  C. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6.048.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand product offering.  C. is now requesting a new loan of 8.736.000 VND which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  The loan will be the 4th loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  C. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business  to improve the general living conditions of the borrower's family.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
To make a living, Tessie is engaged in farming, specifically in producing rice to sell. She has been in her business for 20 years and earns a monthly net income of 2,500 PHP. Tessie L. is 58 years old, married, and has four adult children. She is from the village of Landing, Baliangao. 

In 2005, Tessie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Tessie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase farm supplies. Tessie is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used as additional capital for the farm. This loan will be the 12th loan taken out by Tessie from PMPC. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital for rice production.

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
Sixty-year-old Josphine is a farmer in Kitale town, western Kenya. She is married and has been blessed with 10 children who are all adults. She has been farming for the last 13 years and sells her milk and bananas to the local market. She mainly depends on the income from her farming activities to cater for the needs of her family. 

She has requested this loan of 31,200 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her meet the basic needs of her family. Her biggest challenge in this business has been transportation of her products to the market due to bad roads. In future, she would like to acquire more dairy cows and a chuff cutter (grinder for feed) that will help her increase her milk production.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina D. is from the city of Maquilao Tangub City. She is 48 years old. Regina is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Regina owns and operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing manicure and pedicure services in the local community. Regina has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Regina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Regina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. Regina is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Regina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service.

loans.name: Munyoki

texts.en:
O. is 40 years old married to Esther Mueni who contributes to the family's income. He buys and resells cattle for income. He has been in the business for a period of nine years with an income of about Kshs. 20,000 per month. 

This is his first loan with Kadet and wants to use the loan to buy more cattle for resale. He hopes to give his children a quality education and buy a piece of land for permanent residence.

loans.use: To buy more cattle for sale

loans.name: Nguyễn

texts.en:
T. Nguyễn Thị (20209050045) is a 29-year-old female living in the town of Huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  She is married and has 2 school-aged children.  To making a living, T. owns & operates a business venture raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale.  T. has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3.800.000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2008, T. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  T. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5.600.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies.  T. is now requesting a new loan of 8.288.000 VND which will be used to build shelter for the borrower's livestock.  The loan will be the 4th loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  T. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business.

About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


T. Nguyễn Thị (20209050045) là 29 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Cô ấy đã lập gia đình và có 2 trẻ ở độ tuổi đi học.  Để kiếm sống, T. Sở hữu và thực hiện hoạt động kinh doanh.  Công việc kinh doanh hoạt động tại lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.  Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên T. nhập, mà nguồn T. nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi heo để bán.  T. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, T. kiếm được khoảng 3.800.000 VND một tháng.


Vào 2008, T. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  T. đề nghị khoản vay lần đầu tiên từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua thức ăn gia súc & các loại cung cấp khác.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 8.288.000 VND.  Khoản vay hiện tại sẽ được sử dụng để xây chuồng cho gia súc của người vay.  Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.  T. dự định sẽ sử dụng nguồn T. nhập bổ sung từ công việc kinh doanh  cải thiện/ mở rộng công việc kinh doanh của người vay.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có T. nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam

*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: Build shelter for the borrower's livestock

loans.name: Mwanamkuu

texts.en:
Mwanamkuu is a married woman with five children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. 

She has operated a food sales business for the past five years; she sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. Mwanamkuu faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She hopes to expand her business in the future. 

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase food for her food stall. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase food for her food stall.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
At her young age of 22, Alma never feels tired of doing things to make money for their everyday living. That’s why Alma decided to joined and loan from Kiva field partner, Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI) for the secured capital that she needed for running her buying and selling ventures such as rice, dry goods, and other supplies.
 
Now, her business is still running, but Alma need additional funds for the expansion of her business. She wants to increase her stocks that she sells in her house. This will make her business grow and gain more profits.

Alma has a simple dream, for her family to not experience hard things, which will make her happy and she will never get tired of helping them even in little ways. 

If this dream happens, Alma also hopes to extend her helping hand to others, most especially her relatives who also need support. Alma is very glad for the inspiration and encouragement, which give her strength to continue dreaming of the best in life.

loans.use: To buy more inventory of rice, dry goods, and other supplies.

loans.name: Bayanie

texts.en:
Bayanie M. is from the village of Poblacion 3 Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 27 years old and is single. To make a living, Bayanie owns and operates a business venture in the services sector operating transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating transportation services. Bayanie has been engaged in his business for over 2 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Bayanie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Bayanie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from GDMPC. Bayanie is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to repair his existing vehicle to provide better service. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Bayanie from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair existing vehicle for better service.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita E. is 53 years old, married and has three adult-aged children. She is from the village of Punta Sulong in the municipality of Baliangao, a part of Misamis Occidental province on the islands of Mindanao. Carmelita sells her own ocean-caught fish to the local community. Carmelita has been engaged in her business for over twenty years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Carmelita joined PMPC to gain access to its financial services. Carmelita successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,500 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used as additional capital for her business. Carmelita is requesting a loan of 14,800 PHP, her sixth from PMPC, that will be used to repair her fishing tackle.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy materials to repair her fishing tackle

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 32 years old man married to Agnes 30 years who is a farmer and also owns a salon. They are blessed with two children, aged 12 and eight years.

He has been in the retail business for 10 years and is therefore able to identify his potential clients. He is more likely to succeed because his wife is able to help in meeting the family expenses, thus allowing room for Paul's business growth. He was introduced to Kadet by friends who benefited and this is his first loan. He plans to use the add more stock of wheat, flour, and sugar. With the expected profits, he plans to educate his children to the highest level of education  possible. His future dream is to own a plot and build a house.

loans.use: To purchase more wheat and sugar

loans.name: Stephen Ouna

texts.en:
Stephen Ouna O. is 27 years old and married to Lillian who sells vegetables and fruits. They live next to Kibuye market. 

Stephen is a carpenter and has been in this business for three years. He is applying for his second loan from Kadet Ltd after being introduced to us by a friend who is also a client here. He intends to use the money to buy timber for making chairs, foam materials and buy materials for sofa sets (couches). Stephen makes an income of Kes 10,000 per month.

His desire is to have a big workshop in town and supply furniture on wholesale. Stephen also desires to buy land and build a house.

loans.use: Buy timber  to make chairs, foam for sofa sets

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie P. is 42 years old, married and has two school-aged children. She is from the village of Mabini in the municipality of Baliangao, a part of Misamis Occidental on the Mindanao islands. Elvie makes and sells food, primarily snacks and other delicacies, to the local community. She has been in business for over twelve years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2003, Elvie joined PMPC to gain access to its financial services. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 2,000 PHP from PMPC that was used for personal purposes. Elvie is requesting a new loan, her 22nd from PMPC, of 9,000 PHP that will be used as additional capital for the business.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For additional capital for her food business

loans.name: Kevin  D M

texts.en:
Kevin has been in the transport business for the last three years in Niavasha. He is 39 years old married to Roseline Njeri. They are blessed with three school-age children.
 
This is Kevin’s third  loan from KADET. He paid his previous loan of KES 50,000 in full and in good time. He was introduced to KADET by a friend who is also a KADET client. Kevin will use this loan amount to buy two dairy cows in order to increase his income by selling milk.

His future dream and aspiration is to own another lorry for transportation and be a large-scale dairy farmer

loans.use: To buy two dairy cows in order to increase income by selling milk.

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.en:
D. Nguyễn Thị (20201070037) is a 52 year-old female living in the town of Huyện Yên Phong - B. Ninh.  D. is the group leader of a 4-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Trung Bạn (3).


D. is married and has 2 adult -aged children.  To making a living, D. raises livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale.  D. has been engaged in this business for over 22 years and earns approximately 1.800.000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2007, D. joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  D. has successfully repaid a previous loan of 2.464.000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.  She is now requesting a new loan of 6.496.000 VND which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies.  The loan will be the 5th loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  D. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the her family.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Nguyễn Thị B. (0) is a 36 year-old female who is requesting a 6.496.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

2.  Nguyễn Thị Huế (0) is a 39 year-old female who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.

3.  Nguyễn Thị P. (0) is a 52 year-old female who is requesting a 2.496.000 VND loan to support her business in the services sector operating a tailoring business.

loans.name: Menerva

texts.en:
Menerva T. is 34 years old, married and has four school-aged children. She is from the village of Tabo-o within the municipality of Jimenez, Misamis Occidental province on the Mindanao islands. Menerva operates a retail store from which she sells daily use items such as milk, coffee, sugar, noodles, spices, canned goods, shampoo, soap and toothpaste to the local community. Menerva is just starting this business.

In 2010, Menerva joined GDMPC to gain access to its financial services. She is requesting a loan, her first from GDMPC of 5000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a married woman with one child who graduated from school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees for her younger siblings.

She has operated a poultry business for the past two years, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. In addition she sells fresh water, which contributes to her other source of income. Amina faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  She hopes to expand her business in the future. 

With the 80,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase a water freezer. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase a water freezer

To make a living, Sally makes and sells food.The main source of income for the business comes from selling fried chicken to the local community. Sally has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen V. is 30 years old, married and has two children. He lives in Ijevan. His wife stays at home and takes care of their children while Karen and his parents are engaged in selling fruits and vegetables, which they have done since 2001.

Karen buys fruits and vegetables from Yerevan and other Armenian villages and also from Georgia. He sells them in the Ijevan market by himself and distributes them to other stalls in the market as well. In this way he supports his family.

Karen is asking for a loan of 1,000,000 AMD to buy tomatoes, cucumbers, oranges, mandarins and grapefruits, which he will sell during the New Year’s holidays.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables for the upcoming holidays

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita T. is 56 years old, married and has four adult-aged children. She is from the barangay of Maquilao, Tangub City in Misamis Occidental province on the Mindanao islands. Jovita operates a general store from which she sells a variety of different products to the local community. She has been in business for over fifteen years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Jovita joined GDMPC to gain access to its financial services. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Jovita is requesting a new loan, her third from GDMPC, of 9000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. Mặc dù mỗi tH.nh viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các tH.nh viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Đồng Thôn 3 (17).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ buôn bán các loại thảo mộc & gia vị trong cộng đồng địa phương.  T. thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 N..  Từ các hoạt động này, T. kiếm được khoảng 3.000.000 VND.  Vào 2010, T. đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  0    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.152.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Nguyễn Thị K. T. (0) là 25 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  Nguyễn Thị Hà (0) là 20 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


3.  Trương Thị X. (0) là 46 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


4.  Trương Thị N. (0) là 57 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Rukiri Tukore Group A-Ibanda

texts.en: 42 year old T. Gaudy has been relying on agriculture for subsistence for a decade now. Her business location is Nyamkiika-Rukiri-Ibanda It is a business she says she began after she sold off her cows. The happily married mother of 5 says this business generates her shillings 20,000 a week. She also has a retail shop which she runs on the side. With this loan, she says she is going purchase manure for her gardens. She envisions this will improve the fertility of her gardens as well as her yields.

loans.use: The purchase of manure for her gardens

loans.name: Celestina

texts.en:
Celestina is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She sells cloth and bed sheets from home and from door to door. Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. Celestina faces a major challenge of delayed payments by creditors in her business.

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business. With the 40,000 KES she wants to purchase cloth and bed sheets for resale. She hopes to expand and establish a cloth-selling shop in the future.

loans.use: To purchase cloth and bed sheets for resale

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah is 56 years old, married, and has four children between the ages of 31 and 20 years. She has been farming for the past twenty years, growing such crops as maize, vegetables, and potatoes.

This will be her fourth loan through Juhudi Kilimo, and she plans to use it to purchase poultry.

With the anticipated profits from the loan, she hopes to be able to pay for school fees and better feed her family. In the future, she hopes to own four dairy cows and a poultry farm.

loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Nomeriana

texts.en:
Nomeriana S. is a 62-year old widow who supports her family by operating a candle making and selling business. She lives in Buntol, Brgy. Montañeza, Malabuyoc, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2004 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her candle making and selling business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 5,000. Nomeriana is now borrowing PHP 10,000 so that she can purchase raw materials. This will be her ninth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 7,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Nomeriana aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials for business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Iren

texts.en:
Iren T. is from the town of Western Pob. Lopez Jaena. She is 26 years old. Iren is married. To make a living, Iren owns and operates a business selling a variety of food products in the local community. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as candies, coffee, milk, sugar, meki, behon, beauty products, shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Iren has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Iren joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Iren is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Iren from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Nadia Group

texts.en:
Esther N. is in her mid-twenties and is married with two children. Esther has been running a small fruit and vegetable stall near her house for the past year. The shop is open between 08:00 am and 07:00 pm and earns Esther a low monthly profit. 

This will be Esther's second loan with Tujijenge Tanzania. Esther used her first loan to buy some second-hand clothes, which she began selling door to door. This loan has since been successfully repaid. With her second loan, Esther aims to increase her stock of vegetables at the store. Esther's dream is to earn enough money to buy land and to start building herself a house. 

Esther will share this loan with her loan group, Nadia, which totals 16 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loans.

In the picture, Esther is the first on the left, wearing black and white.

loans.use: To increase her stock of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is from the village of Makawa, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is 43 years old. Joy is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Joy owns and operates a specialized retail store in the local community. Joy has been engaged in her business for over four months and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.
In 2003, Joy joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Joy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Joy is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This will be the second loan taken out by Joy from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

About PMPC:
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital to run her retail store

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick Achiambo is 29 years old and is married to Margaret. They have three children. Peris is seven years old, and both Jagen and Javan are three years old. They live in the Kibuye area.

Fredrick is a carpenter and has been in this business for the past four years. He is applying for his second loan from KADET LTD after successfully completing the first one. Fredrick intends to buy velvet materials for the sofa sets he makes, and also foam sheets and lumber to make chairs. Fredrick makes a monthly income of about $250.

His desire is to expand and open another business in the town center and he hopes to have his children well educated.

loans.use: Buy lumber, foam sheets and velvet materials

loans.name: Merilyn

texts.en:
Merilyn T. is engaged in farming particularly in producing assorted crops to sell as her main source of income.  She has been in this activity for more than 12 years and earns a monthly net income of 2,300 PHP.  Merilyn is from the village of Lusot, Baliangao.  She is 41 years old, married with one school-aged child.

In 2005, Merilyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Merilyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC.  Merilyn is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for the farm.  This loan will be the 11th loan taken out by Merilyn from PMPC. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Zakayo Kwenya

texts.en:
Zakayo  has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last ten years. He is 36 years old and married to Virginia Njeri. They have three children.

He got to know about KADET through various marketing activities carried out by KADET staff members in Ndunyu Njeru town. This will be his second loan. He paid his first loan of 10,000 KES in full and in good time. He plans to use this loan to buy fertilizers and seedlings and pay for laborers.

In the future, Zakayo hopes to increase farm production by practicing large-scale farming and also venture to dairy farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, seedlings and pay for laborers.

loans.name: Shakirah

texts.en:
Shakirah N. is 35 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala south region of Uganda. She is married and has four children, all of whom are currently in school. Shakirah has a business selling food and vegetables, which she has run for seven years.
To help expand her business, Shakirah has requested a loan of 1,500,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more food and vegetables. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Shakirah hopes to generate greater profits and buy food. In the future, Shakirah hopes to own another business.

loans.use: To purchase food and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a married woman with three children, two of whom attend school while one is still too young for school.  She owns a house that  has electricity and piped water.  Her greatest monthly expenses are water bills, school fees, food and clothing for the family. 

For the last four years, she has operated her rental houses. In addition she also sells fresh water to her neighbors whichis her other source of income.  Christine faces a major challenge of competition in her business.  She hopes to build five more rental houses in the future. 

With the 80,000 KES loan she wants to renovate her rental houses, purchase cement, paint and pay for labor.  She decided to join Yehu to access loans and improve her business and her standard of living.

loans.use: To renovate her rental houses, purchase cement, paint and pay for labor.

loans.name: Denis

texts.en:
Denis M. is 24 years old and has been working as a farmer for the past four years. He sells products such as milk, maize, beans, and vegetables to the local market and various retailers.

This will be Denis' first loan with Juhudi Kilimo. With the anticipated profits, he hopes to further expand his business. In five years, he hopes to have acquired another dairy cow to double his milk production and profits.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Esmerna

texts.en:
Esmerna P. is from the town of Puntod Lopez Jaena. She is 40 years old and married. To make a living, Esmerna owns & operates a fishing business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling fresh fish in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 1,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Esmerna joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from GDMPC, and is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This will be Esmerna’s third loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisher-folk and small-business entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Nora

Nora J. is from the village of Marapong, Sibutad. She is 58 years old, married and has 4 grown children. To make a living, Nora owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector planting assorted crops to sell. She has been engaged in her business for over 28 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

Nora has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC, which was used as additional capital for her business. She is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used as additional capital for rice production. This will be Nora’s 9th loan from PMPC. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.name: Grace Wairimu

texts.en:
Grace has been operating her restaurant business for the last three years in her town Ndunyu Njeru. She is a 41-year-old single mother with two children.

She was introduced to KADET by a credit officer from KADET. This will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to purchase food  for her restaurant and to buy furniture.

In the future she hopes to be the owner of a chain of restaurants in Ndunyu Njeru and its surrounding area.

loans.use: To purchase more food for  her restaurant and to buy furniture.

The main source of income for the business comes from selling baked goods in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month.

In 2009, Ana Lore joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC, and is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be Ana Lore’s third loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family’s general living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisher-folk and small-business entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Josephine

Josephine N. is 47 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala south region of Uganda. She is single and has six children, four of whom are currently in school. Josephine has a retail shop business, which she has run for two years.         
To help expand her business, Josephine has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase beans and sugar. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Josephine hopes to generate greater profits and pay her children's school fees. In the future, Josephine hopes to own a grocery store.

loans.name: Antonio Jr

The main source of income for the business comes from harvesting & selling wild-caught fish in the local community. He is just starting this business.

In 2009, Antonio Jr joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from GDMPC, and is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase equipment to improve the business. This will be Antonio Jr’s second loan from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisher-folk and small-business entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward K. is 35 years old, married, and has three children from the ages of 3 to 9. He has been farming for the past seven years and sells milks, eggs, and vegetables to the local market. He also has a motorcycle transport business.

This will be Edward's third loan with Juhudi Kilimo, and he plans to use it to purchase poultry. This will result in greater egg production, used for home consumption and sale, leading to increased income for his family.

In the next five years, Edward hopes to have 1,000 poultry, a posho mill, and act as the main egg supplier to the local market.

loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Raphel

The main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products such as fish in the local community. Raphel is just starting this business.

In 2010, Raphel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. Raphel is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish to raise. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Raphel from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers, and small-business entrepreneurs.

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers, and small-business entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Juma

texts.en:
Juma is a married man with one child who is still too young for school. He owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

He has operated a boda boda (motorcycle) business for the past two years. Neighbors and passersby are his potential customers. Juma faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business. He hopes to expand and purchase a car for hire in the future. 

With the 20,000 KES loan, he wants to purchase another motorcycle. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve his business.

loans.use: To purchase another motorcycle

loans.name: Joseph Kariuki

texts.en:
Joseph has been a farmer in Ndunyu Njeru town for five years. He is 50 years old, married and blessed with eight children.

He discovered KADET through its various marketing activities in his town. This will be his first loan. He plans to use the loan to buy fertilizers, seedlings and to hire workers.

Joseph hopes to boost his farm production and increase his number of dairy cows.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, seedlings and cater for the labour.

loans.name: Ombui

texts.en:
Ombui A., 72, is married, and has eight children, ages of 30 to 45.  He has been farming for the past fifteen years and sells products such as tea, bananas, maize and milk at the local market.

This will be his first loan through Juhudi Kilimo and he plans to use it to purchase a dairy cow.  In the next five years, he hopes to grow more bananas and have a total of five dairy cows.

With the anticipated increase in profits, he hopes to improve the food availability for his family and increase their standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Martina

texts.en:
Martina T. is 55 years old, married and has one adult-aged child. She is from the city of Maquilao, a part of Tangub City in Misamis Occidental province on the islands of Mindanao. Martina raises pigs to sell. She has been in business for over ten years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Martina joined GDMPC to gain access to its financial services. Martina successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from GDMPC. Martina is requesting a new loan, her second from GDMPC, of 8000 PHP that will be used to invest in expanding the business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.name: Mary Owiti

texts.en:
Mary Ogondo is 43 years old a widow and has three children; Fredrick, 20 years, Josephine, 22 years and Chris, 13 years old.

Mary sells motor vehicle spare parts in Jua Kali, in Kisumu county.  She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by a friend who is a client.  Mary wants to use the money to buy motor vehicle spare parts to add to her stock.  Her monthly income is Kes 12,000. 

Her desire is to expand her business and open another hardware shop.

loans.use: Buy more motor vehicle spare parts

loans.name: Ondara

texts.en:
Ondara M. is 22 years old and has been farming for the past four years. He sells products such as milk, tea leaves and vegetables locally.

This will be his second loan from Juhudi Kilimo, and he plans to use it to purchase another dairy cow. In five years, he hopes to boost his income enough to be able to buy a plot of land and expand his farming business.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey, 60, is a farmer from the town of Nkubu in eastern Kenya.  He has been farming for the last five years and employs one worker. He grows potatoes, maize, beans and wheat which he sells at the local market.  He is a retired teacher, and apart from farming he depends on his pension to meet his family's needs.

He recently completed a loan from Juhudi Kilimo in the amount of 45,000 KES.  Now he wants to borrow 80,000 KES for his fish farm.  He says that this loan will help him expand his business and increase his income enabling him to improve his family's standard of living. 

His primary challenges have been poor weather conditions, pests and diseases which affects his production.

Geoffrey is married with five children, who are adults.  He says Juhudi is working with farmers at a grassroots level, and he is happy about that.

loans.use: For fish farming.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel R. is 48 years old, married and has seven adult-aged children. He is from the village of Masabud, a part of the municipality of Clarin, Misamis Occidental province on the Mindanao islands. Samuel operates a transport service. He has been in business for over a year and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Samuel joined GDMPC to gain access to its financial services. Samuel is requesting a loan, his first, of 10,000 PHP that will be used to repair his existing vehicle so it can provide better service. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of his family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair his vehicle for better service

loans.name: Laurence

texts.en:
Laurence is a thirty-five-year-old married man with five children. He lives in a semi-permanent house in the district of Kyenjojo, Uganda.

Laurence wants a loan to buy sugar, soap and cooking oil to sell at his shop. He dreams of becoming a wholesaler, having a permanent house and educating his children so that they can have a better future.

loans.use: To buy sugar, soap and cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Alice Wangithi

texts.en:
Alice is 36 years old, a widowed mother of three children. She lost her husband through a traffic accident in 2006. She has been operating her rice farm for eight years now with an income of 8,000 Kenyan shillings per month. 

She is taking a third loan with KADET LTD and she intends to use the loan to buy farming needs and pay for labor and harvest expenses.  She hopes to provide a higher level of education for her children.

loans.use: to buy farming needs and pay for labor and harvest expenses

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith D. is from the city of Sta. Cruz Tangub. She is 30 years old, married, and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Judith owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Judith joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be Judith’s first loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family’s general living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisher-folk and small-business entrepreneurs.

She has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Leonisa joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC, and is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be Leonisa’s second loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family’s general living conditions.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisher-folk and small-business entrepreneurs.

He has been dealing in second-hand clothes for twenty years amidst the challenge of price fluctuations. His vision is to educate his children and build another house.  Zephanous intends to use his loan to buy more second-hand clothes for sale.

loans.use: Buying second-hand clothes for sale

texts.en: Justus needs a loan to buy manure for his tea plantation, which he has had for the last seven years.  He is a married man with ten children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda.  He has a desire to invest in this tea plantation as a permanent scheme, and to educate his children.
