loans.use: To purchase seeds, mineral fertilizer and sheep

loans.name: Hloniphile Group

texts.en:
Bongekile is 36 years old and single with two children, ages four and thirteen. She also takes care of three relatives. She runs a business selling chickens at home and tupperware door to door in KwaZulu-Natal, South Africa.

She has been running this business for two years and faces the challenge of finding enough chickens to keep in stock. She has requested this loan through WDB and Kiva to purchase additional chickens and tupperware to resell. She hopes that her business will grow and that this loan will help her to get a car for her business and provide more food for her family. 

Bongekile is the leader of her group of five borrowers and is on the far left in the photo above.

loans.use: To purchase chickens and tupperware for resale

loans.name: Sherali

texts.en:
K. Sherali is 40 years old, married, and has four children. He has spent many years growing wheat and vegetables on land that was given to him by his father.  Together with his wife and brother, he works hard in the field so that he can send his children to school in the future when they are older. Sherali says, "Life in the field is never easy. I plow using the traditional method all day, not minding the heat of the sun because I have an ultimate goal for my kids, and that is to give them a better future." 

Sherali is requesting a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants. He deeply appreciates the trust and support you’re giving him.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants

loans.name: Dora Club Group

texts.en:
Nomasalamuzi is 60 years old and single with three children, aged between 16 and 40 years. She sells shoes in a marketplace in Empangeni in South Africa (KZN). She also earns income from the government’s old age pension. She says that the main challenges to her business are customers that buy on credit and fail to pay on time.

She requested this loan through WDB and Kiva to buy supplies and glue for making shoes. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to put her 16-year-old child into computer school. With the help of WDB and Kiva, she would like to see her business grow and get machines for making shoes.

Nomasalamuzi is the leader of her group of five borrwers, and is wearing an orange shirt in the photo above.

loans.use: To purchase supplies and glue for making shoes

loans.name: Idikhuja

texts.en:
L. Idikhuja is 41 years old. Together with his wife, who works to help pay household expenses, they have five children. His goal for his children is to support them so that they may complete their studies leading to professional careers.

Idikhuja has worked as a farmer for the past five years. The greatest obstacles for him are pests. He began his work with his own efforts, and the help our organization was able to offer led to better production. With this loan Idikhuja will invest in the purchase of fertilizers and high quality seeds to get a better harvest, which he will be able to sell at a better market price. Let’s support this hard-working man so that he can reach his goals!

loans.use: Purchasing of the seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Rustamjon

texts.en:
Rustamjon is married with two children. He sells men’s clothing in the local central market of his region. This market is always busy with clients. He offers a nice selection of merchandise for sale and arranges it beautifully in his kiosk, which attracts many potential customers. He has been in this trade for many years.

Rustamjon is requesting a loan of $2500 to increase the range of goods for selling. One of his business plans is to open a second vending facility and hire a sales person to work as a market vendor in the same market. With increased sales and profits, Rustamjon will be able to open an additional vending facility and improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase new clothing in order to increase the range of goods

loans.name: John Karanja

texts.en:
John has been practicing farming in Naivasha town for the last nine years. He is 40 years old married to Leah Nduta. They have two child going to school.

He was introduced to KADET by his friend who is also a member of KADET. This will be his second loan. He paid his previous loan of KES 10,000 in full and in good time. He plans to use the loan amount for land preparation and buying seedlings for planting.

In the future, John hopes to increase farm production by practicing large-scale farming.

loans.use: For land preparation and buying seedlings for planting.

loans.name: Bakhtiyor

texts.en:
O. Bakhtiyor was born in 1984. He is single and works in agriculture. The income he makes from selling agricultural products enables him to manage his household expenses. However, the profit from agriculture has decreased considerably and it is difficult for him to meet the needs of his large family, which includes his brothers and parents. 

To make his business more productive again, Bakhtiyor is asking for a loan of $2,000 to buy seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants and thus increase the production capacity of his land. This will improve the living conditions of an entire family.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants

loans.name: Guljahon

texts.en:
Guljahon is widow and has five children. After the death of her husband, she had to find some way to provide for her children. That is how she became a market vendor. Today Guljahon sells children’s clothing and footwear. Her prices are always reasonable. She has been in business for ten years. Financial assistance has helped her business grow and expand. 

Guljahon is requesting a loan of $2,000 to purchase clothing wholesale to sell over this Christmas season. Her business is the only source of income for her family. That is why she is determined to work 24/7 to provide for their needs and stimulate the growth of her trade. One of her plans is to open a new vending facility in the local market and hire an employee to help her run the business. We believe her natural liveliness and enthusiasm will help Guljahon achieve her goals and continue as a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: To buy new goods in order to increase the range of goods for resale.

loans.name: Kinanasi

texts.en:
Kinanasi is a married woman with five children, four of whom attend school while one is still too young for school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past seven years; her potential customers are neighbors and passers-by. Kinanasi faces a major challenge in the high cost of transportation in her business. She hopes to establish a retail shop in the future. 

With the Kshs 25,000 loan, she wants to purchase stock of wheat flour, rice and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase stock of wheat flour, rice and cooking oil.

loans.name: Brisa Del Este Group

texts.es:
El comité se ha formado con la gestión de la señora Blanca Oviedo, actualmente ex integrante, quien vive en Monday _C.D.E. Ella contactó con sus vecinas y amigas para conformar el grupo en la zona.
El comité se denomina Brisa del Este. Están en el Séptimo Ciclo y está constituido por 15  integrantes; es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unido y responsable.
 Las integrantes poseen un gran espíritu emprendedor, ya que están al día con las cuotas, trabajan en conjunto en  la realización de actividades para recaudar fondos que puedan salvaguardar al comité en caso de necesidad, y pretenden terminar esta etapa con muy buen cumplimiento con la institución.
La presidenta del Grupo es la señora Felicia quien se dedica a la venta de ropas.
Comenta que está en una zona muy competitiva por la gran cantidad de negocios y ofertas que hay, y muchas veces es muy difícil vender las mercaderías con que cuentan, por lo que constantemente deben recurrir a técnicas de ventas.
Ella adquiere sus mercaderías de varios lugares, busca las ventajas de cada una uno para tener una buena ganancia en la hora de la venta.
Nuevamente solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de sus mercaderías como vestidos, remeras, lencerías en general, zapatilla, bijouterie y otros.
texts.en:
This committee was formed by Blanca Oviedo who is no longer a member of the committee and lives in Monday, Ciudad del Este.  She contacted her neighbors and friends to form a group in her area.

The committee is called 'Brisa del Este'.  It is in its 7th loan cycle and has 15 members.  This is a group that stands out in the neighborhood because it is united and responsible.  The members have a great enterprising spirit and are up to date with their loan repayments.  They work together in their activities to make funds which can safeguard the committee if necessary.  They plan to end this stage by fulfilling their duties to the institution.

The group's president is Felicia who sells clothes.  She says that she is in a very competitive area because there are many businesses and offers.  It is often very difficult to sell her merchandise.  For this reason she must constantly employ different sales techniques.

Felicia acquires her merchandise in several places.  She looks for the advantages that each place offers so that she can make good profits when she comes to sell.  She is requesting a new loan to invest in buying merchandise suchy as dresses, t-shirts, underwear, sports shoes, jewelry, etc.

loans.use: To buy dresses, t-shirts, underwear, sports shoes, jewelry, etc.

loans.name: Veronica Chepkew

texts.en:
Veronica Chepkew T. is 38 years old, married to Andrew Dimakon who is also a  businessman and this is also a source of additional income for the family. They have four school going children of age 14,12, 9 and 5 years, their residence is in Kapenguria-Kenya. She has been a tailor and has been in this business for three years with good income.

Veronica learned about KADET LTD through a credit officer and so she is applying for her second loan of Kshs.40,000 from KADET LTD, which she intends to purchase a sewing machine. With the anticipated profits, she plans to build her own house.

In the future, Veronica wishes to live a better and more comfortable life.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Hodari Group

texts.fr: Bachinyunjuze S. C. conseillère du groupe Hodari, c est entrepreneur, âgée de 50 ans, mariée, mère de 8 enfants, dont 4 étudient et les 4 autres n’étudient pas faute de moyens financiers. Son mari est chômeur.  Elle vend des bassins, gobelet, plat, sceaux, etc. (en plastic). Elle  commença son business  avec son fonds propre  reçu de son mari. Il ya 3 ans qu’elle est en action. Plus tard, elle bénéficia de crédit de l’IMF  Hekima de 50$ en 2006. Elle installe ses produits  au long de la rue, devant la boutique de son ami. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner  avec  les 12 sceaux, 65 bassins, 24 gobelets, 24 plats, etc. En plus, elle ambitionne acheter une parcelle et scolariser confortablement tous ses enfants. La cliente Bachinyunjuze S. C. remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres exclus de banque classique. Le groupe Hodari est constitué de 15 membres .
texts.en: Bachinyunjuze S. C., advisor of the  Hodari Group, is a 50 year-old entrepreneur.  She is married and the mother of 8 children, 4 of whom are in school and 4 who are not, due to a lack of funds. Her husband is unemployed. She sells plastic bowls, cups, plates, dishpans, etc. She began her business with funds received from her husband. She started her business three years ago. Later, in 2006, she received a loan of $50 from the Hekima microfinance institution. She displays her products along the street in front of her friend's shop.  This new loan should enable her to stock up with 12 buckets, 65 bowls, 24 cups, 24 plates, etc. In addition, her ambition is to buy a plot of land and educate all her children comfortably. The client, Bachinyunjuze S. C., thanks Hekima for its actions in favor of poor people excluded from traditional banks. The Hodari group consists of 15 members.

loans.use: To buy 12 buckets, 65 bowls, 24 cups, 24 plates, etc.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Ahlidin

texts.en:
M. Ahlidin is a 51-year-old cattleman who is married with two children. He has been involved in this business since he was a young man. He purchases cattle in the local market and then he breeds and sells them. The cattle are kept in the house and it takes a lot of effort to care for them. Every day Ahlidin gets up early in the morning to feed his animals, and all day until late at night he is busy looking after the cattle. Ahlidin says that he works with only one aim in mind - to provide his children with proper education. Now, Ahlidin would like to expand his business and purchase more cows. For this purpose, he has applied for $2000 USD and with your help he hopes to reach his aim.

loans.use: Purchase cattle to expand his business

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a married woman with two children.  One child attends school while the other one is still too young for school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but no running water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a vegetable stall for six years, selling at the local market to her neighbors and those who pass by.  Grace's major challenge is the transportation of goods. In the future, she hopes to expand and sell wholesale vegetables to other businesses.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables and tomatoes to sell in her stall. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase green vegetables and tomatoes

loans.name: Akram

texts.en:
Fruit and vegetable sales are a flourishing business because every home needs fruit and vegetables. Akram has been selling fruits and vegetables in Dushanbe for the past 12 years. He began his own stall with his hard earned savings as he always wanted to be an entrepreneur. Akram began selling in Dushanbe market with very little stock to offer his clients. Slowly he began to increase the goods offered until he managed to get a permanent market stall. Currently his stall is his pride and joy with a zinc roof and ceramic tiles on the floor. Now Akram needs a loan of $3000 USD in order to increase his inventory. He promises to repay the loan without any violation and expresses his gratitude to everyone supporting him.

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Increase the inventory of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase bundles of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Herminio

texts.es:
Descripción	L El Sr. Herminio  está  casado, tiene tres   hijos,  todos  en edad escolar.
Él se dedica a la venta de bebida en su domicilio  y en el microcentro de C.D.E, la misma cada vez más está en ascenso, generándole un buen ingreso.

Con la ayuda de su esposa  están  saliendo adelante con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo.
Hoy día él es un microempresario exitoso con una clientela fiel y numerosa, debido a su amabilidad.
Ha demostrado ser una persona responsable y honesta en sus compromisos por lo que debemos brindarle todo el apoyo necesario en sus emprendimientos. 
En esta ocasión solicita el préstamo para cargar su negocio con muchas variedades de bebidas ya que se quiere preparar para las fiestas de fin de año y aprovechar el gran aumento de la venta de bebidas en esta época.
texts.en:
Herminio is married and has three school-age children.  He sells soft drinks from his home and in Ciudad Del Este's business district.  His drinks business is growing and makes him a good income.

With the help of his wife, Herminio is getting ahead in life through a lot of sacrifice and hard work.  He is a successful small businessman who has a loyal and large customer base owing to his kindness.  He has shown himself to be a responsible and honest person in his commitments which is why we must provide him with all the support he needs in his undertakings.

On this occasion, he is requesting a loan to stock his business with many different kinds of drinks since he would like to prepare for the end-of-year party season and take advantage of the large increase in drink sales during this period.

loans.use: To buy soft drinks

loans.name: Ilhomjon

texts.en:
Ilhomjon B., 24, is married and has three children. His wife is a housekeeper. As the family's sole bread-winner, Ilhomjon works hard selling blankets, towels and children's clothes, a business he has had for nine years. He secures the goods from neighboring China and then supplies his customers in the market. Good quality items and attractive prices have allowed him to establish and maintain his clientele base, and the resulting stable income has allowed him to improve the family's living conditions.

Today Ilhomjon requests $2000 USD to purchase additional goods to sell. He would like to thank everyone for their support and promises to repay the loan on time.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes its role a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To putchase blankets, towels and different kinds of clothes to increase the range of goods for sale.

loans.name: Nkuranyabahizi

texts.fr: J. C. NKURANYABAHIZI  est marié, et il a 3 enfants entre 4 ans et 10 ans.  Il a une éducation primaire, et tous ses enfants vont à l’école.  Il va utiliser son prêt pour acheter du ciment, sable, et planches pour la construction.  Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est d’épargner pour augmenter l’activité.  Il voudrait avoir une maison, et la réhabiliter et retourner a l’école pour continuer et  terminer ses études.
texts.en: J. C. NKURANYABAHIZI  is married. He has three children between the ages of four and ten. He went to primary school and all is children are going to school. He will use his loan to purchase cement, sand, and boards for construction. His strategy to grow the business is to set aside money to increase his activity. He would like to have a house, to restore it and to go back to school to continue and finish his studies.

loans.use: Purchase of cement, sheet metal, trees, screws, three-layer boards and wood planks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a quarry site

loans.name: Ezra

texts.en: Ezra, aged 30 years, is a married man living in a semi permanent house in Kyenjojo Uganda. He is a farmer and deals in Irish potatoes and maize. He dreams of educating his children, building and expanding his plantations. He wants a loan to buy Irish potatoes for planting.

loans.use: To buy Irish potatoes for planting

loans.name: Nelly Waithira

texts.en:
For the last year, Nelly has been selling ice cream in the town of Niavasha. She is 42 years old married to Peter Muya. They are blessed with two children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend. This will be her first loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy a deep freezer and increase her ice cream stock in order to serve the ever-increasing customers.

In the future, Nelly aspires to open a chain of ice cream selling businesses in Naivasha.

loans.use: To buy a deep freezer and increase her ice cream stock .

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a married man with two children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He is doing commercial agriculture, which he has done for the last six years. However, he faces a problem of price fluctuations. He would like a loan to purchase land. 

Charle's ambitions are to invest in modern farming, build a permanent house and educate his children.

loans.use: To purchase a piece of land

loans.name: Muhamadi

texts.en:
Muhamadi is a 32-year-old married man with three children. He lives in a permanent house in the district of Kyenjojo Uganda. He is a motorcyclist and has been in the transport sector for five years. 
He dreams of educating his children so that they can have a better future and putting up a permanent house and his business goal is to have atleast three motorcyvles.
Muhamadi wants a loan to buy another motorcycle.

loans.use: Buying another motorcycle for transport business

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is a 27-year-old married man with four children. He lives in a semi-permanent house in the district of Kyenjojo, Uganda. 

He is a motorcyclist and has been in business for six years now. He dreams of educating his children so that they can have a better future and buying another motorcycle since the sector is lucrative.

Christopher wants a loan to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: To buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Bright

texts.en: Bright is a 32-year-old married man with two children and owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. He has been buying and selling produce for the last ten years, having started with 12 bags of maize and increased to 300 bags. His hardships include: debtors, price fluctuation, poor means, and increased transport costs. His vision is to supply to institutions around Kasese and Hima, plus educate his children. Bright intends to use the credit facility to buy maize and beans to resell.

loans.use: Buying maize and beans for resale

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is a married woman with six children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated an open-air food business for the past three years, selling from home to her neighbors, passersby, and school-going children. The major challenge Mwanasiti faces in her business is seasonality. She hopes to be self-reliant in the future.

With the 35,000 KES she wants to purchase stock of food, maize flour, wheat flour, and rice. She decided to join Yehu to get a loan to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase stock of food, maize flour, wheat flour, and rice

loans.name: Mapendo Group

texts.fr: Mabulayi N. est présidente du groupe d’affaire Mapendo, entrepreneur, mariée,  mère de 9 enfants. Tous ses enfants étudient confortablement. Son époux est artiste. Elle vend des sacs usagers (sac à main, mallette, valise, etc.) communément appelé « the second hand ». Elle  commença son business  avec son fonds propre depuis 1983. Plus tard, elle bénéficia de crédit de l’IMF  Hekima de 50$ en 2004. Elle installe ses produits  au long de boulevard Vanny Bishweka. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir de s’approvisionner  avec  50 pièces des sacs et renforcer la construction de sa maison, qu’elle envisage mettre à location d’ici là. En plus, elle ambitionne acheter un véhicule (voiture) de déplacement. La cliente Mabulayi N. remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres exclus de banque classique. Le groupe mapendo est constitué de 14 membres.
texts.en:
Mabulayi N. is the president of the Mapendo business group. She is an entrepreneur, a wife, and a mother of nine. All her children are studying without worry. Her husband is an artist.
She sells used bags (purses, briefcases, suitcases, etc.) under the general name  « the second hand ». She started her business with her own funds in 1983. Later, in 2004, she was the beneficiary of a $50 loan from IMF Hekima. She displays her products along Vanny Bishweka boulevard. This new loan is to be used to stock up on 50 more bags and to improve her house structure, which she is considering renting out soon. Beyond this, her ambition is to purchase a vehicle (car) for her travels. As a client, Mabulayi N. thanks Hekima for their actions in favor of underprivileged people who are excluded from traditional banking systems. The Mapendo group counts fourteen members.

loans.use: Purchase 50 handbags and improve the structure of a house

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is a 41-year-old married man with five children and owns a house in Kasese. He has been retailing clothes and cosmetics for the last ten years. He increased the capital of the business by initially selling coffee. The challenge he faces is that of buying expired cosmetics. His vision is to expand his business. David needs the loan to buy clothes and cosmetics to sell.

loans.use: Buying clothes and cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Hannah Wanjiru

texts.en:
Hannah has been operating a retail general shop in Naivasha town for the last five years. She is 44 years old married to Patrick Kamama. They are blessed with one child.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend. This will be her first loan, and she plans to use the loan for increasing her stock of dairy milk in the shop.

In the future, Hannah hopes to open a supermarket in the town of Naivasha.

loans.use: For increasing her stock of dairy milk in the shop.

loans.name: Darlison

texts.en:
Darlison is 32 years old and single, with four children ages 2 to 16. She has no other dependents, and she lives in a family of five people. Darlison owns her home, and her family goal is to educate her children. 
She sells secondhand clothes and has been doing it for one year now. She started by selling produce; she saved her income and started the secondhand clothes business. She faces the challenge of clothing going out of fashion and also fading if it stays in stock for long. In the future she hopes to transform her business into a wholesale business. She wants the loan to buy more secondhand clothes to add to her stock.

loans.use: Purchase of Second Hand Clothing.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a married woman who owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

She operates a tailoring business from home, selling to her neighbors and passersby. The major challenge Mercy faces in her business is seasonality. She hopes to establish a big tailoring shop in the future.

With the 20,000 KES she wants to purchase cloth materials for her tailoring business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase cloth materials for her tailoring business

loans.name: Peter Ekwanga

texts.en:
Peter Ekwanga L. has been in transport business of motorbike service for the past one year in Lodwar-Kenya. He is 35 years old, married to Pauline Enyagan and they have three children of aged 4,3, and 1 years old. From his transportation business, Peter earns a profit of KES.12, 500 per month.

He is applying for his second loan from KADET LTD of KES.50,000, which he plans to buy another motorbike. With the anticipated profits, he plans to invest in the business for it to grow. 

Peter hopes to buy a Nissan for public service in future, which will enable him to provide for the family basic needs.

loans.use: To buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 33-year-old married woman with four children who owns a house in Kasese, Uganda. She has been selling cassava flour for the last five years. She started selling in the market but now has a store. However, the hardship is that during the rainy season, transport is expensive. 

Her vision is to own a milling machine and educate her children to higher institutions of learning. Beatrice needs the loan to buy cassava flour.

loans.use: To buy cassava flour

loans.name: Tamara

texts.en:
Tamara A. was born in 1961 in Ijevan. She is married and has a 29-year-old son.

Tamara works at the Armenian post office as a mail carrier. She also has her own business, trading fruits and vegetables in the Ijevan market since 2003. Tamara’s son helps her in this business. He runs the business in the morning, while Tamara delivers mail. Thanks to this business, they can provide their family’s needs.
 
Tamara needs a 500000 AMD loan to buy fruits and vegetables for her business.
 
This is Tamara’s fifth loan from Nor Horizon and second loan from Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables for her business

loans.name: Basoka Kwavula Group

texts.en:
Ndora is a 30-year-old married woman with five children. She lives in a permanent house in the district of Kyenjojo Uganda. She dreams of becoming a whole seller and educating her children so that they can have a better future. 
Ndora wants a loan to buy sugar, soap, cooking oil  for selling at her shop. 

Ndora is a member of Basoka Kwavula group where each member guarantees the other for access to credit.

loans.use: Buying sugar, soap and cooking oil  for resale

loans.name: St.noah Development Group

texts.en:
Boneface is a 22-year-old married man with one child. He lives in a permanent house in the district of Kyenjojo Uganda. He wishes to have all the required gadgets for his barber shop and run a successful shop and educate his children so that they can have a better future.
 
Boneface wants a loan to buy shaving machines. 

Boneface is a member of St. Noah Development group, in which each member guarantees the other for access to credit.

loans.use: Buying shaving machines

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma A. is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, electricity bills and school fees.   

She has operated a fresh water selling business for the past year, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Mwanajuma faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. During the summer season the water dams get dry and there is not enough water. She hopes to expand and supply water to a larger market.

With the 60000 KES she wants to purchase a water pump. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump

loans.name: Isrrael

texts.es:
El Sr. Isrrael está casado, tiene una hija mayor de edad.
Él se dedica a la venta de Harina de Maíz  de forma ambulante  por la zona de Minga Guazú, la misma cada vez más está en ascenso, generándole un buen ingreso.

Con la ayuda de su esposa y su hija  están  saliendo adelante con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo.
Ha demostrado ser una persona responsable y honesta en sus compromisos por lo que debemos brindarle todo el apoyo necesario en sus emprendimientos.
El solicita el préstamo para la compra de gran cantidad de maíz, ya que habrá mucha venta
texts.en:
Isrrael is married and has a grown-up daughter.  He sells corn flour as a street trader in Minga Guazú district.  His business is growing and it is making him good profits.

With the help of his wife and daughter, he is getting ahead through a lot of sacrifice and hard work.  Isrrael has shown himself to be a responsible and honest person in his commitments which means that we must provide him with the support he needs in his undertakings.

Isrrael is requesting a loan to buy a large quantity of corn since he will have a lot of sales.

loans.use: To buy corn

loans.name: Mugisa

texts.en:
Mugisa E. is 39 years old and married with 7 children aged 2.5 to 14 years. He also has 3 dependents. His wife owns a salon. He lives in Hoirna Town, in a family of nine people and he owns his home. His goal is to educate his children.

He has been in the produce business for 3 years. He started by farming and then selling produce but now he buys from other farmers. He faces a challenge of price fluctuations of produce. He hopes in the future to buy his own milling machine. He wants the loan to buy supplies of rice.

loans.use: To purchase supplies of rice to sell

loans.name: Elijah  Barno Kitur

texts.en:
Elijah Barno Kitur K. has been in the transport business of Public Service motorbike for the past 10 years in Eldoret-Kenya. He is 22 years old, married to Selinah Maiyo and they have no children yet. His wife also has a business, this adds to the income to the family. Out of the transport business Elijah earns a profit of KES.9,000 per month.

He is applying for his first loan of Kshs.30,000 from KADET LTD, which he plans to use to buy another motorbike. The anticipated profits he plans to invest in his wife's business. 
  
Elijah hopes to own a pickup-for-hire, which will enable him to provide for the family basic needs.

loans.use: To buy another motorbike.

loans.name: David Kivatu

texts.en:
David has been operating a general shop in Naivasha town for the last two years. He is a 28-year-old married to Monicah Wairimu. They are blessed with one child.

He was introduced to KADET LTD by his friend. This will be his second loan. He paid his first loan of KES 30,000 in-full and in good time. He plans to use the loan for increasing his stock in the shop to cater for the high demand of commodities during the festive season.

In the future, David hopes to expand his business to a wholesale shop in Naivasha town.

loans.use: For increasing his stock in the shop to cater for the high-demand commodities during the festive season.

loans.name: Vukanathi Group

texts.en:
Thomozani is 50 years old and single with three children between the ages of 13 and 31. She also cares for two relatives. She operates a retail business around the Richards Bay area of KwaZulu-Natal, South Africa.

She has been selling chickens, hand bags, and perfumes for a year and hopes to also begin selling goats and providing public phones. She faces challenges when customers buy bags on credit and fail to pay on time. She has requested this loan through WDB and Kiva to purchase additional chickens, hand bags, and perfumes for resale. She hopes that the extra income generated will help her pay her childrens' school fees to allow them to graduate. 

Thomozani is happy that WDB and Kiva have come together and hopes that her business will grow bigger and that her children will have better lives.

Thmozani is the leader of her borrower group and is pictured above in the center of the photo.

loans.use: To purchase chickens, bags, and perfumes for resale

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman who owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For over ten years, she has operated a doughnut selling business from home. She sells to her neighbors and passersby. Fatuma faces a major challenge of competition from other doughnuts sellers in the market. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

With the Kshs 15,000 loan she wants to purchase wheat flour, cooking fat, yeast and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access funds to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase wheat flour, cooking fat, yeast and sugar.

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is married. He is a farmer from Kamenka. Alexander grows early spring vegetables and sells them wholesale and retail in the markets of his region. Alexander owns 3 big arch greenhouses. He started this business 5 years ago. Alexander has invested 40,000 Grivnyas in the venture. Currently, he spends about 5,000 – 7,000 Grivnyas on seeds and polyethylene film.  

Alexander is seeking a loan of 8,000 Grivnyas to construct a new greenhouse to be able to grow more tomatoes in spring. Alexander started working on it, however, he didn’t have the finances to finish it. Therefore, he is planning to use financial assistance to buy polyethylene film and complete the construction process. One of Alexander’s other short-term plans is to build another two greenhouses on his property, thus expanding his farming enterprise and boosting his sales. Alexander is very ambitious. He wants to grow and further develop his business.

loans.use: to construct a greenhouse

loans.name: Mawangala Development Group-Lugazi

texts.en: 45 year old I. James like many of his contemporaries doing subsistence farming also runs a food business in Mawangala-Lugazi. It is a business he began 6 years ago with a set objective of improving and giving a new lease of life to the welfare circumstances of his family. He says his big brother was a major influence. His hard work has in the course of time enabled him make headway in running and consolidating his business niche. James who is happily married with 8 kids, 4 of whom attend school. His future plan is to open up a shop and build a family house provided his business prospects continue to improve, especially the generated profits. At present, this business brings in  150,000 shillings as weekly profits. With this loan, he says he is going purchase more food  to resell.

loans.use: The purchase of more foods for reselling

loans.name: Mariya

texts.en:
Mariya is married with a grown daughter and a teenage son. She is a retail entrepreneur from Ivano-Frankivsk, Western Ukraine. Mariya owns a small store downtown Ivano-Frankivsk. She sells children’s clothing merchandise, stuffed toys and games. Mariya has been in the trade for 5 years. Her monthly income amounts to 7,000 Grivnyas. 

Mariya is requesting a loan of 10,000 Grivnyas to purchase assorted children’s clothing and toys to meet the growing customer demand this holiday season. She is hoping to generate additional income this winter and keep both of her hired employees employed in winter when many other market entrepreneurs have low sales and are forced to dismiss their employees. Mariya is hoping to use extra profit to finish construction work on her private house. The retail business is the only source of income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase assorted merchandise

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

She has operated a clothing business for the last year,  She sells at the market to her neighbors and market dwellers. She hopes to expand and establish a big clothes shop in the future.

With the 40,000 KES, she wants to purchase a bale of clothes for sale. She decided to join Yehu because it has no legal requirements.

loans.use: To purchase a bale of clothes for sale.

loans.name: Elimelich

texts.en:
Elimelich is a 34 year old tailor married to Catherine, 30 years old, who is also a tailor. They are blessed with one child who is five years old. Elimelich has been in the tailoring business for the last five years which has enabled him to identify his potential clients and fast moving types of clothes. With the combined efforts from his wife, he is likely to succeed because of a division of labor whereby each can specialize in what he/she is good at. He plans to use the anticipated profits from his business to hire extra staff so as to boost his production and increase his income.

His future aspiration is to own a clothing company.

loans.use: Add stock to his tailoring business

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is 25 years old and married. She operates a retail shop so as to earn a living. She has been in the business for two years. She also does farming for extra income.  

She has managed to grow her business through Faulu Kenya. Her dream is to expand her business into a wholesale one in the future. She has requested a loan of 80,000 Kenyan shillings to buy maize flour and crates of soda.

loans.use: To buy maize flour and crates of soda

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence N. lives in the Kisaasi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has two children, both of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (a sister). 

Florence has a business of selling charcoal. She has been in this business for two years and she works seven days out of every week. Florence sells her products at the market, by means of retail. 

Florence has requested from MCDT SACCO a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. She also generates additional income through cooked food vending.

The main business challenges for Florence include seasonality and transportation. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling on a wholesale basis only and also to build her own house. 

Florence lives in a home that she rents; she doesn't have access to electricity but has access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, food and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Mykola

texts.en:
Mykola is married with a 5-year-old son and a 1-year-old daughter. He is a small-business owner from Ivano-Frankivsk, where he runs a transportation services venture. Mykola has been working in this sphere of business for six years. He owns a motor car and rents it out to another driver working for him. He has a van that he uses to offer transportation services in his region and beyond. 

Mykola’s income amounts to 9,000 Grivnyas every month. Mykola is seeking a loan of 7,000 Grivnyas to do engine repairs and buy winter tires and a car battery for his vehicle. The business is the only source of income for the family. One of Mykola’s biggest dreams is to purchase his own housing and make sure his family has everything they need.

loans.use: To do engine repairs and to buy winter tires and a car battery

loans.name: Manyi Development Group-Lugazi

texts.en: 43 year old Norah N. is affliated with Manyi Development Group-Lugazi. She has been operating a poultry enterprise in Nyamwezi for ten years. She says she began this business with her own savings from an erstwhile clothes selling business. Painstakingly, she has with determination and conviction made good strides in establishing and obtaining a firm footing for her business over these years. Norah is happily married with 8 kids and she says weekly her profits measure up to UGX 90,000. She says with this loan she is going to buy more chicks.

loans.use: To purchase more chicks

loans.name: Hezron

texts.en: Hezron is a 37-year-old father of four. To support his family, he runs a retail shop. Since he opened the shop, he has seen a lot of growth. He thanks Faulu Kenya for supporting him financially and for the financial training that they provide in their seminars. He also rents out houses to boost his income. He needs a loan of 80,000 Kenyan shillings to expand into a wholesale business.

loans.use: To expand into a wholesale business

loans.name: La Paz Group

texts.es:
Para la formación el presente comité inicio la Señora Mari Luz, quien vive en la zona  D. Barrio San Sebastián de Presidente Franco.
 La Señora decidió formar el comité en la zona, para ello  Contacto con sus vecinas y amigas para formar el grupo en su comunidad.
El comité se Denómina “La Paz” están en el Séptimo  Ciclo   con 20   integrantes, es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unidas   y responsables entre ellas, las mismas poseen un gran espíritu emprendedor, ya que realizan labores para la recaudación de la caja chica.
Una de las integrantes es la señora Elizabeth quien se dedica a la venta de remedios naturales.
Esta actividad lo viene realizando hace un buen tiempo y le deja buena ganancia ya que ella compra los remedios en gran cantidad por bolsa y lo fracciona en pequeñas cantidades para volver a vender.
Para la compra de nuevas mercaderías (bolsa de manzanillas, boldos, y otros) ella solicita el préstamo.
texts.en:
Sra. Mari Luz led the organization of this committee.  She lives in the San Sebastian neighborhood of Presidente Franco.  It's a local committee that she organized by asking her friends and neighbors to join.  The group is called "La Paz" (Peace) and is now starting its seventh round of fundng with 20 members.  The group is notable in the neighborhood for being united and responsible in their dealings with one another.  The members share an entrepreneurial spirit and all operate small businesses.
One of the members is Sra. Elizabeth who operates a business selling herbal medicines.  She has operated the business for a while now and it's profitable because she buys wholesale supplies of the herbs and sells them in smaller batches.  She will use the loan to buy supplies of new herbal medicines (bags of apple blossom, boldos, etc.).

loans.use: Buy wholesale supplies of herbal medicines.

loans.name: Peace Development Group-Mukono

texts.en: 26 year old S. Isma's affiliation is with Peace Development Group-Mukono. It is now 5 years since he  began his retail shop in Kalagi. The shop attracts a wide variety of customers. He says credit goes to his father who was instrumental in helping him get started. Determination and hard work have helped him get this far in his operations. Isma is happily married with 2 kids and he says with this loan, he is going to purchase more retail stock for sale at his shop.

loans.use: The purchase more retail stock for sale

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary O. is 35 years old and married to Peter Otiemo. They have three children: Marvin is 12 years old, Susan is 9 years old and Hellen is four years old. They live in the Nyamasaria area. Rosemary has a hair salon business, which she has had for the past 11 years; she has created a huge clientele due to her admired work on women’s hair. Rosemary is applying for her fourth loan from KADET and has a good credit history. Rosemary has a monthly income of Kshs 10,000. She intends to buy hair pieces for braiding, hair oil, shampoo, and also to renovate the building. In the future, her desire is to expand and have a big salon and boutique. She also desires to see her children realize their goals through education.

loans.use: To buy hair oil, shampoo and hair pieces.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is a 22-year-old businessman who sells shoes. Besides that, he does mobile phone repairs as a part-time job for extra income. He works hard in his business so as to provide for his wife and his 7-year-old child. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to manage his finances by saving his money on weekly basis. He aspires to be a successful businessman in the future. He has requested a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings to add to his stock of shoes so that he may increase sales during the festive season when the demand is high.

loans.use: To add stock of shoes

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca N. lives in the Kisaasi neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has three children, all of whom are in school. 

Rebecca sells half bricks as a business. She has been in this business for 10 years and she works one day out of every week. Rebecca sells her products in a shop on a wholesale basis. 

Rebecca has requested from MCDT SACCO a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings, which she will use to buy more half bricks for resale. She also generates additional income through her beauty salon.

The main business challenges for Rebecca include transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully stocked hardware shop.

Rebecca lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and has access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more half bricks for resale

loans.name: Cornelio

texts.es: El señor  Cornelio nacido el 16 de septiembre en Vallegrande, es casado y  tiene 3 hijos mayores ya independientes, se dedica a la agricultura Hace 3 años el viene trabajando solo con EMPRENDER con el primer crédito compro terreno, con el segundo compro su parcela cerca de la carretera y con este crédito va a comprar una Motosierra para sacar madera. También se dedica a la ganadería, cría ovejas y vacas, vende también leche a una institución muy conocida de la ciudad de Santa Cruz, es una  persona muy trabajadora y responsable con el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en: Sr. Cornelio, born September 16, in Vallegrande, is married with 3 grown children, all now grown.  He operates a farming business.  Three years ago, he started working with EMPRENDER, using his first loan to buy land.  He used his second loan to buy a parcel of land near the highway and he will use this loan to buy a chainsaw for cutting timber.  Sr. Cornelio also raises cattle and sheep.  He sells milk to a well-known company in the city of Santa Cruz.  Sr. Cornelio is a hard-working man and committed to repaying the loan in the agreed-upon time.

loans.use: Chainsaw for timber business.

loans.name: Kamene

texts.en: Kamene is 29 year old single mother of two school-going children. She has a retail shop, which she has been running for three years, that has a profit of Kshs 2,000 per month. This is her third loan with Kadet; she repaid her previous loans successfully. Kamene hopes to own a big shop and become a wholesaler in the future. She also hopes to give her children a quality education and improve their living standards.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, maize and flour for her shop.

loans.name: Sammy Wanyoike

texts.en: Sammy Wanyoike K. is 36 years old and is married to Jane Karuana. They have three children, who are 12, eight and four years old. They live in Eldoret-Kenya. Sammy is motorcycle mechanic and has been in this business for the past 15 years. He is applying for his sixth loan from KADET after successfully completing the fifth one. Sammy intends to buy spare parts for motorbikes. Sammy makes a monthly income of KES 45,000. His desire is to expand and open another business in the town center and hopes to have his children well-educated.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for motorbikes.

loans.name: Petua

texts.en:
Petua N. lives in the Mengo MacKay neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has three children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (her father).    

Petua has a business of selling charcoal. She has been in this business for six years and she works seven days out of every week. Petua sells her products at the market, by means of retail.    

Petua has requested from MCDT SACCO a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. The main business challenges for Petua include transportation and defaulters.  

Her goals and aspirations for her business are to expand her business. Petua lives in a home that she rents; she doesn't have access to electricity or piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 34 years old and married. She is blessed with two children, aged 11and 7.  For a living, she does gardening and landscaping. She has been running the business for three years and she has employed 28 people. She was previously selling clinic equipment for a living.  

She hopes to stabilize her business so that she gets more customers.  With the loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings, she will buy more flowers for planting in her nursery.

loans.use: To buy flowers to plant in a nursery

loans.name: Justus

texts.en: Justus has a mixed farm in Nkubu town, eastern Kenya that produces bananas, maize, cabbages, tomatoes and milk, which are sold locally. He also owns a shop in the same area. He has requested this loan of 70,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow. The extra income from this loan will help improve the living standards of his family. He plans to specialize fully in dairy farming by acquiring two more dairy cows and constructing a better zero grazing shed. Justus is 57 years old and married with three adult children.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Nseenya Zinnunula Omunaku Group-Lugazi

texts.en: A decade ago is when 35 year old M. Robert ventured into his current farming business in Nseenya-Lugazi. He like many other Ugandans subsists and shoulders most of his family's responsibilities with profits from this business. Robert principally plants and sells tomatoes. He also keeps and sells poultry. Robert says farming has been a long term business undertaking. The happily married father of seven says his future plan is to give his children a worthwhile education. He reckons with improving business conditions, this will, at length, be probable. With this loan, he says he is going to expand his business operations. Buying some more acres of land is high on his priority list after he gets this loan.

loans.use: The purchase more acres of land.

loans.name: Los Cedrales Group

texts.es:
La señora Crisolina R., ex integrante de este grupo, domiciliada en Acaray de Minga Guazú, contactó con sus vecinas y amigas para formar el comité en la zona, ya que muchas de ellas tienen emprendimientos que necesitan ser apoyados.
El nombre que han puesto al comité es  “Los Cedrales”, en homenaje al barrio de la mayoría de ellas.  Están  en el Quinto Ciclo, con 12  integrantes. Es un grupo que se destaca  por ser muy unido, solidario  y responsable. Las integrantes tienen actividades diferentes. 
Las mismas poseen un gran espíritu emprendedor, ya que están al día con las cuotas, realizan actividades de recaudación de fondos para terminar esta etapa con muy buen cumplimiento con la institución. 
Una de las integrantes es la señora  Norma quien  se dedica a la atención de un salón de belleza que posee en su casa. 
Ella es una mujer muy sacrificada que trabajo desde muy joven. 
Ella tiene su clientela formada y sus clientas recurren frecuentemente hasta su salón por su buena atención. 
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de productos que utiliza en su peluquería, como cremas de enjuagues, shampoo, aceites y otros.
texts.en:
Sra. Crisolina R., a former member [of another group], lives in Acaray de Minga Guazu.  She organized a local committee after inviting friends and neighbors from the area to join, many of whom have small businesses that need support.  The group is called "Los Cedrales" after the neighborhood in which most of them live.  The group is starting its fifth round of funding with 12 members.  
The group is notable for being united, cohesive and responsible in their dealings with one another.  The members operate various businesses.  They share an entrepreneurial spirit and manage their loans wisely because they want to repay it on time and remain in good stead with the bank.  
One of the members is Sra. Norma who owns a beauty salon that she operates from her house.  She has worked since she was very young and has had to sacrifice a lot.  She now has a good customer base and her customers come back to her again and again.  She is applying for a loan to buy supplies for the salon: creams, shampoo, oils, etc.

loans.use: Buy supplies for beauty salon business.

loans.name: Flora

texts.es: La Sra. Flora vive en el municipio de el Torno,  hace unos 25 años que llego del Departamento de Tarija , nacida en el departamento de Tarija, ella se dedica a la venta de jugos de fruta natural y también a la  elaboración de una variedad de galletas y empanadas que vende junto con los jugos, ella tiene un puesto de venta donde ya muchos de los clientes le visitan por sus deliciosos jugos y empanadas,  su esposo con el cual tiene dos hijos se dedica al transporte de personas(taxi), hace unos 4 años,  el destino del crédito es para aumentar su capital de trabajo e invertir en muebles en su negocio comprando mesas y sillas para dar comodidad a sus clientes.
texts.en: Sra. Flora lives in the town of Torno.  She was born in the "departamento" of Tarija and came to Torno from there some 25 years ago.  She operates a business selling natural fruit juices.  She also makes and sells a variety of empanadas and snacks that she sells with her fruit juices.  She has a stand where her customers come back, time after time, to buy her delicious fruit juices and empanadas.  Sra. Flora's husband, with whom she has two children, has operated a taxi business for 4 years.  She will use this loan to increase her working capital.  She plans to buy tables and chairs for the business so that she can provide a better service to her customers.

loans.use: Buy tables and chairs for food business.

loans.name: Peter Kipkosgei

texts.en:
Peter Kipkosgei K. of Eldoret, Kenya has been in motorcycle transport business for one year. He is 24 years old and is married to Stella Kosgei They have no children yet. From his transportion business, Peter earns a profit of KES.10,000 per month.

He is applying for his first loan of KES.20,000 from KADET LTD. He plans to use it to open a retail shop. He plans to invest the anticipated profits from his business in shop for his wife. 
 
In the future, Peter hopes to run a supermarket, which will enable him to provide for his family's basic needs.

loans.use: To open a retail shop.

loans.name: Julio Ricardo

texts.es: El Sr.  Julio se dedica al comercio de artículos de oficina y otros desde hace ya 25 años, y de esa manera y con el tiempo a logrado progresar y mantener a su familia la cual lo apoya incondicionalmente, Don Julio cuenta con domicilio propio lo cual demuestra su gran trabajo y sus deseos constantes de superación. Don Julio recurrió a nosotros debido a que por estas épocas la demanda en general de los diferentes artículos y productos que ofrece aumenta significativamente , con el crédito Comprara Mercadería (Relojes, Timbres, Comunicadores, Flash, ect.)El Sr. Julio viene trabajando con nosotros hace ya un tiempo y ha demostrado ser un excelente cliente motivo por el cual no se le negó dicho crédito,
texts.en: Sr. Julio has operated a business selling miscellaneous supplies for 25 years.  Over the years, the business has allowed him to support his family and improve his standard of living.  Don Julio owns his own house, a testament to his hard work and his commitment to overcoming all the obstacles in his way.  He approached us because this is the time of year when demand for products like his goes up significantly.  He will use the loan to buy merchandise (watches, alarm clocks, computer equipment, etc.).  Don Julio has been a customer of the bank for several years and has shown himself to be a good customer, deserving of the bank's trust.

loans.use: Buy merchandise to resell.

loans.name: Gleiny Luz

texts.es: La ropa,  los cosméticos, los productos naturales , son el pan de cada día de Gleiny  P., una mujer de 27 años que vive en la Ciudadela 20 de Julio, y que todos los días se mueve entre estas mercancías: comprándolas, costeándolas, definiendo sus precios, exhibiéndolas, promocionándolas, consiguiendo nuevos clientes  y vendiendo todo lo que compra.   Así pasan los días de Gleiny entre la atención de su hija menor de un año y su negocio,  que es su ingreso principal e inició hace un año en su propia casa; esta es  la razón  por la que ha construido su principal clientela entre sus vecinos, familiares y referidos y aunque la competencia es fuerte, se sostiene porque es muy amigable y ofrece  precios competitivos    y muchas veces mejores , pues ella está muy pendiente de lograr descuentos y promociones que beneficien a sus compradores, así  mismo   los clientes se sienten satisfechos porque los  plazos y formas de pago son concertadas con ellos mismos . Gleiny vende de contado y a crédito, su rotación de inventarios es de 6 días y su razón corriente es de 2,09 veces; en la actualidad está postulada a recibir su primer financiamiento a través de la linea crediKiva, con este financiamiento comprará colonias, cosméticos, productos naturales y fantasias, para responderle a los clientes en la mejor época del año, en la que se incrementan sus ventas sobre pedidos. Su sueño se concentra en trabajar  en su negocio para tener una casa propia, porque en el   futuro visiona a su hija como una profesional  exitosa y muy próspera.
texts.en:
Clothes, cosmetics, and natural products are Gleiny P.’s daily bread and butter.  She is a 27 year old woman who lives in the 20 de Julio neighborhood.  Every day she is involved with this merchandise.  She selects it, pays for it, sets the prices, displays it, and sells it.  This way she gets new customers, and she sells all that she purchases.

That is how Gleiny spends her days, between taking care of her one year old daughter and her business.  This is her main income, and she started a year ago in her own house.  That is why she has built her customer base among her neighbors, relatives, and referrals.  There is strong competition.  She keeps going because she is very friendly, and her prices are competitive and often lower than the competition.  She watches carefully for discounts and promotions that will benefit her customers.  Her customers are very satisfied because the terms and payment arrangements are set up with the customers themselves.

Gleiny sells for cash and credit.  She rotates her inventory every six days.  Her current ratio (working capital ratio that measures liquidity) is 2.09.  She is now looking forward to receiving her first Kiva loan.  She will use the loan to buy cologne, cosmetics, natural products, and novelties.  She will do this in order to be in tune with her customers during the best season of the year.  This is the season when orders and sales increase.

Her dream is to concentrate on working in her business in order to have her own house.  In the future she envisions her daughter as being a successful and very prosperous professional.

loans.use: To buy cologne, cosmetics, natural products, and novelties

loans.name: Luciana

texts.es:
La Sra. Luciana   es Viuda,  tiene una  despensa  en el barrio San Alfredo,  la venta en la misma es gratificante ya que cuenta con una considerable cantidad de clientes y el ingreso es bastante satisfactorio.

Con la ayuda de sus hijos   están  saliendo adelante con voluntad, trabajo y dedicación.
Hoy día se ha convertido en una microempresaria exitosa y en constante progreso. 
Ha demostrado ser una persona responsable y honesta en sus compromisos por lo que debemos brindarle todo el apoyo necesario. 
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercaderías para su despensa como harina, azúcar, arroz, fideos, y otros.
texts.en:
Luciana is a widow. She has a small grocery store in the San Alfredo neighborhood. Sales are good because she has a considerable number of customers, and the income is quite satisfactory.

With the help of her children, they are getting ahead by their will, work, and dedication. This has become a successful small business which is consistently making progress. 

Luciana has shown herself to be a person who is honest and responsible in her obligations, which is why we should provide her the necessary support.

She is requesting the loan to buy merchandise for her store such as flour, sugar, rice, noodles, and other items.

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar, rice, noodles, and other items

loans.name: Mukami

texts.en: Mukami is a 73-year-old married lady who is blessed with nine children. She runs Mukami N. Rentals where she rents out houses.  She has been running the business for twenty years.  Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has managed to expand her rental houses hence more income.  She dreams of building an apartment in the future.  She has requested 50,000 Kes so as to get capital to start a business of selling livestock.

loans.use: To buy livestock for resale

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is 40 years old and a father of three.  To earn a living, he sells seedlings.  He has been running the business for four years.  Besides, he runs a bakery.  Through Faulu Kenya he has managed to buy rabbits which earn him extra income.  He dreams of becoming financially stable in the future.  He has requested 50,000 Kes to buy livestock and seedlings for resale.

loans.use: To buy livestock and seedlings for resale

loans.name: Ayawovi

texts.fr: Ayawovi a 40 ans et a en charge un enfant. Pour améliorer les conditions de vie de son enfant, elle fait la vente de produits d’alimentation générale. Dans cette activité, elle compte 9 ans déjà.  Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé et revend ensuite dans une boutique à Bè Souza.  Elle est née à Lomé et réside quartier Bè.  Elle sollicite un crédit pour renouveler le stock de marchandise.
texts.en: Ayawovi is 40 years old and has one dependent child. To improve the living conditions of her child, she sells general grocery products. She already has nine years of experience in this activity. She gets her supply from the great market in Lomé and then resells in a store in Bé Souza. She is born in Lomé and lives in the Bè neighborhood. She is soliciting a loan to renew her merchandise stock.

loans.use: Purchase of food products

loans.name: Monica Angelica

texts.es: La señora Mónica se dedica a la venta de comida ya hace bastante tiempo, también trabaja como cocinera y limpieza en una institución no le pagan mucho es por eso que ella vende comida solo los  días de feria ya que esos dias tiene mucha venta, y mucha clientela por los deliciosos platos que prepara, es muy conocida por su buen sazón, con el trabajo de ella y su esposo sobrellevaron a su familia día a día,  su esposo se dedica a la cerrajería. La señora Mónica le ayuda cuando tiene bastante trabajo, La señora saco el crédito para comprar ollas, amoladora, para  mejorar el negocio de su  esposo, esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Mónica has been selling food for a long time. She also works as a cook and janitor at an institution. They don’t pay her much, so that is why she sells food on market days. Those are the days when sales are best and she has a lot of customers because of the delicious foods that she prepares. She is well-known for her good cooking.

With her job and her husband’s, they take care of the family from day to day. Her husband is a locksmith. Mónica helps him when he has a lot of work. 

She is taking out the loan to buy cooking pots, and also a grinder to improve her husband’s business. She is very grateful to the institution for the support it has provided her.

loans.use: To buy cooking pots, a grinder, a drill, an other items

loans.name: Janiffer

texts.en:
Janiffer is 33 years old, married with two children.  She has been running a health clinic so as to earn a living.  It is ten years since she started the business and she has been able to grow the business through Faulu Kenya.  

Janiffer gained experience for running a clinic because she was previously employed in a hospital.  She has requested 50,000 Kes to stock more medicine.

loans.use: To stock more medicine

loans.name: Mburucuja Group

texts.es:
Para la formación el presente comité inicio la Señora Felicita S. quien vive en el barrio Mubucuja de _C.D.E. Ella Contacto con sus vecinas y amigas para formar el comité en su barrio.
El comité se Denomina”Mburucuja  “están en el 9  Ciclo   con 15  integrantes, es un grupo que se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unidas solidarias  y responsable entre ellas,  realizan actividades para la recaudación de fondos para el comité, en caso de que algunas compañeras este con dificultades para pagar.
La señora Gloria es la presidenta del grupo y se dedica a la venta de lencería  de  varias marcas por catálogos. 
Ella se integro al comité para trabajar en grupo y también para obtener el capital que invertiría en el comité. 
En esta ocasión solicita el préstamo para la compra de artículos de lencería ya que recibió muchos pedidos y quiere cumplir con todos los clientes.
texts.en:
It was Mrs Felicita S. who formed this current committee.  She lives in Mubucuja neighborhood of Ciudad Del Este.  She contacted her neighbors and friends to set up the committee in their neighborhood.  The committee is called “Mburucuja”.  It is in its 9th loan cycle and has 15 members.  This is a group which stands out in its neighborhood for the unity, solidarity and responsibility of its members.  The members carry out activities to make funds for the committee in case anybody should find themselves struggling to pay.

Gloria is the group's president.  She sells different brands of lingerie through catalogs.  She joined the committee to work as part of a group and so that she could obtain capital that she would invest in the committee.  On this occasion, she is requesting a loan so that she can buy lingerie since she has received a lot of orders and she would like to be able to fill every customer's order.

loans.use: To buy lingerie

loans.name: Assou

texts.fr: Assou a 40 et est marié. IL a 3 enfants.  Pour répondre aux besoins de ses enfants, il exerce la cordonnerie et associe la fabrication de chaussures.  IL cumule dans cette activité près de 9 ans déjà. IL achète les matières premières de fabrication à Bè et au grand marché. Après la fabrication, les chaussures sont vendus dans un atelier dans le quartier Afagnakomé. Il demande un prêt pour acquérir  4 douzaines de semelle et  10 douzaines de cuir.
texts.en:
Assou is 40 years old and married with three children. 

In order to provide for his children, he works as a cobbler and shoe-maker. He has almost nine years of experience in this activity. 

He buys the raw materials in Bè and at the big market. Once manufactured, the shoes are sold in a shop located in the Afagnakomé district. 

He is seeking a loan to buy four dozen soles and ten dozen pieces of leather.

Purchase of raw materials

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials for shoe repair and shoe-making

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is 31 years old, married and with two children.  He runs a retail shop so as to earn a living.  He is also employed as a driver.  He has been running the business for four years.  Through Faulu Kenya, he has been able to save his money.  He hopes to become a prosperous businessman in the future.  He has requested 40,000 Kes to buy sugar, cooking fat, maize and wheat flour.

loans.use: To buy sugar, cooking fat, maize and wheat flour

loans.name: Susana Mercedes

texts.es: La señora Susana vive en casa de alquiler  con sus dos hijos. Ella quedo muy joven viuda cuenta que fue un golpe duro para ella, pero tenia que salir adelante, y tubo que buscar a que dedicarse ya que antes solo su esposo se dedicaba a la mantener el hogar,  ahora se dedica a la venta de pescado y  mariscos, lo hizo con el poco capital que tenia, poco a poco fue siendo conocida por restaurantes famosos. Ahora ella entrega al por mayor y menor, le va muy bien en esta actividad, pero no tiene suficiente espacio para poner los mariscos ya que estos le mandan desde Perú o Ecuador y es por ese motivo que solicito el crédito para comprar dos nuevas heladeras y así se mantengan frescos sus productos, esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Susana lives in a rental house with her two children.  She was left a widow at a very early age.  She tells us that it was a very hard blow for her but that she had to get ahead and had to look for a business activity to make money since, up until that point, her husband had been the only one who supported their household financially.

Susana now she sells fish and seafood.  She set herself up with a bit of capital that she had and gradually became known by some famous restaurants.  Now she delivers her products wholesale and retail.  She is doing very well in this business but she doesn't have enough space for her seafood  since they send them from Peru or Ecuador.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan so that she can buy two new fridges to keep her products fresh.  She is grateful to the institution for the support she has received.

loans.use: To buy two fridges

loans.name: Michael

texts.en: Michael is 27 years old, married and with two children aged 4 and 2.  He runs Stanley Crafts where he sells curios.  In his business, he has employed one person.  He has been running the business for three years and has seen a tremendous growth since he joined Faulu Kenya. He hopes to succeed in his business in the future.  He has requested 30,000 Kes to enlarge his business.

loans.use: To enlarge his business

loans.name: Boniface

texts.en: Boniface is 30 years old and a father of one.  For a living, he sells second-hand clothes.  He has been running the business for four years.  He is also employed in a restaurant. He joined Faulu Kenya so that he would access financial resources easily and save his money.  He has requested a first loan of 30,000 Kes.  He will use the loan to buy more clothes.

loans.use: To buy more clothes

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
El Señora Beatriz F. C., es madre de un hijo al cual está educando sola porque es madre soltera el padre de su hijo se fue hace como dos años y desde entonces la señora se dedico la venta de abarrotes en un mercado de la localidad de Ivirgarzama (mercado de la Playa de Autos), esta muchacha es muy joven, trabajadora y muy dedicada a su hijo, de lunes a viernes trabaja como mesera en un restaurant donde ella es bien tratada y los fines de semana trabaja en su puesta en el mercado local, poco a poco ella va levantándose para así poder tener una mejor vida tanto para ella como para su hijo.

Es la primera vez que la cliente obtiene un préstamo de nuestra institución cuyo destino será la compra de mercadería y así poder tener una mejor variedad de productos los cuales podrá ofrecerlos a sus cliente, lo que le permitirá también mejorar sus ingresos consecuente mente mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mrs Beatriz F. C. has one child who she is educating alone because she is a single mother.  Her child's father left two years ago and since then she has been selling groceries in a local market in Ivirgarzama (Playa de Autos market).  This girl is very young, hard-working and devoted to her child.  From Monday to Friday she works as a waitress in a restaurant where she is well treated.  At weekends she works on her stall in the local market.  She is gradually lifting herself up so that she can have a better life for herself and her child.

This is the first time that Beatriz has had a loan from our institution.  She will use it to buy merchandise so that she can have a better variety of products to offer her customers.  This will allow her to improve her income and thereby improve her quality of life.

loans.use: To increase her working capital

loans.name: Kotognontala  (Ayons La Même Voie) Group

texts.fr:
Kotognontala  est un regroupement des femmes du quartier Darsalam  de la ville de Koutiala qui se connaissent bien. Elles  vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 38 ans, sont mariées et mères d’au moins 4 enfants.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels, les produits alimentaires, les habillements,  les céréales etc. 
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles viennent  d’avoir leur premier prêt de groupe. 
Aramata C. est  la seule du groupe  qui vend  exclusivement du pain.  
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, au fur et à mesure du pain. Elle se procure  du pain chaque matin de bonne heure à la boulangerie Badegna de Koutiala sur la route de San. 
Elle vend  du pain à la gare routière de Koutiala en détail et au comptant au grand marché de Koutiala à une clientèle diverse et variée. Sa vente journalière varie entre 100 et 120 miches de pain. 
Tandis que Les membres du groupe comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 60 000FCFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle, Aramata C. compte réaliser 70 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses courantes de la famille. 
Elles souhaitent renforcer leur partenariat avec  Soro Yiriwaso pour pouvoir diversifier leurs marchandises.
texts.en:
Kotognontala is a group of women from the neighborhood of Darsalam, in Koutiala, who know each other well. They live in large traditional families with their husbands, children, and other relatives. On average, they are 38 years of age and married with at least four children.

These women sell various items such as food, clothing, grain, etc. In order to expand their activities, the members decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution. They recently obtained their first group loan.

Aramata C. is the only group member who exclusively sells bread. She plans to use her loan to sustain her stock of bread. She gets bread early every morning at the Badegna bakery, in Koutiala, on the road to San.

She sells bread at retail, for cash, at the bus station and the big market of Koutiala to a diverse clientele. She sells 100 to 120 loaves of bread per day.

While the group members expect to earn an average profit of 60,000 FCFA each during this cycle, Aramata hopes to make 70,000 FCFA.

In addition to repaying the loans, the members use a portion of their income to cover ongoing family expenses.

They wish to strengthen their partnership with Soro Yiriwaso in order to diversify their merchandise.

loans.use: Buying bread

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah is 34 years old and blessed with two children.  She does dairy farming so as to earn a living.  She sells milk to the people of her local neighborhood.  Besides farming, she is employed as a nursery school teacher.  She dreams of increasing the cows in her farm for more output.  She also plans to buy a pick-up for transporting milk from the farm to her customers. She has requested 20,000 Kes to buy more cows.

loans.use: To buy dairy cows

loans.name: Sérieux Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Sérieux est un constitué de cinq femmes qui vivent dans le même quartier, Darsalam de la ville de Koutiala, dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et coépouses. Elles ont en moyenne 36 ans, sont mariées et mères d’au moins 3 enfants.
Ce groupe sérieux fait l’achat et la vente de produits cosmétiques, d’habillements  de  bois de chauffe et des fruits et légumes.
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles viennent d’avoir leur premier prêt de groupe.
