It is a growing part of the city, which was born out of a land taken by local residents a number of years ago.  It is relatively well established now and consists primarily of individuals with few resources who work in nearby factories, public transport or other jobs.  Silvia is married and lives with her husband.  They have three children.

Silvia raises animals in corrals behind her home.  Specifically she raises pigs, which she sells in local markets or to wholesalers once they reach the appropriate size and weight.

The loan proceeds will be used to purchase additional feed and to expand her corrals.  She hopes to be able to grow her business to better care for her animals and increase the capacity of her farm.  She is happy to be able to earn an income on her own and help in meeting her family’s needs.  She dreams of sending her children to school and providing them with assistance to attend a university or traD. school.

loans.use: To purchase additional feed and expand her corrals

loans.name: Paulino

texts.es: Paulino, de 42 años, es un hombre muy humilde y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Hilda de 37 años y sus 3 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo al que se dedica Paulino, es la siembra de cacao, café y hojas de coca, los cuales después de cosecharlos, vende en la ciudad de San Francisco. Él tiene varios clientes, que sabiendo de la calidad de sus productos no dudan en esperarlo para comprarle todo al por mayor. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y hacerlas fértiles y productivas, lleva 8 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es fumigar sus chacras, ya que tiene que hacerlo con mucho cuidado, puesto que no quiere que los químicos le causen daño a su organismo. En adelante, espera comprar o alquilar nuevas tierras para ampliar su producción. Este es el sexto crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, si desea acceder a otro crédito en el futuro. En su banco comunal, es un socio muy responsable y preocupado por el bienestar de su grupo. Con los dos mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono para mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en: Paulino is 42 years old. He is a very humble and hard working person. He lives in his own home together with his wife, Hilda, 37 years old, and their 3 beloved children to whom he wishes to provide with a better quality of life. Paulino has cocoa, coffee and coca leaf plantations which he harvests to sell in the city of San Francisco. He has various clients who, knowing the quality of his products, do not hesitate to wait to purchase the lot in wholesale. What he most enjoys about his work is sowing the fields and making them fertile and productive. He has 8 years in the business and the most difficult part of his work has to spray the plantations. He has to spray very carefully so that the chemicals he uses will not damage the plants. In the future he hopes to purchase or rent more land in order to increase his production. This is his sixth loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and he knows that payments need to be made on time if he wishes to access another loan in the future. He is a very responsible member of his community bank, always looking out for the welfare of the group. With the requested fifteen hundred nuevos soles he will purchase more fertilizer to improve his plantations.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is fifty-two years old.  She lives with her partners and their two children in the small town of Sipan in the district of Zaña.  It is an agricultural community in the coastal desert of northern Peru, located approximately forty-five minutes outsiD. of the major city of Chiclayo.

Rosa owns a small general store, which she operates out of the front of her home.  She has run the store for approximately five years and has a number of loyal customers.  Her clients appreciate having access to items of basic need, such as soap, food, dry goods and candy, near their homes.  They also appreciate the good service she provides and her positive attituD..

The loan will be used to purchase additional merchandise.  She hopes to be able to expand her selection and also deepen her inventory so that she can consistently meet her customers' demands.  She also hopes to be able to meet the specific needs of her clients during the holidays for items such as toys, paneton (a product similar to fruit cake) and decorations.

This is Rosa's first loan with Kiva's partner, Edpyme Alternativa, and will be her first experience with a financial institution.  She appreciates the opportunity to be able to use credit to leverage her assets and business in order to improve her lifestyle and that of her neighbors.  She hopes to be able to continue growing her business, make improvements to her home and proviD. her children with good educational opportunities.

loans.use: To expand her selection and increase her inventory

loans.name: Marilus

texts.es:
La señora Mariluz es socia del banco comunal La Flor De La Canela 2, del distrito de Manantay, departamento de Ucayali, tiene 38 años y es madre soltera. Tiene 4 hijos menores en edad escolar.
Para mantener y educar a sus 4 hijos, Mariluz ha tenido que trabajar en todo lo que se le presentaba, hasta que decidió poner un pequeño negocio, una bodega pequeñita  que con mucha dedicación está haciendo crecer, lleva trabajando con los préstamos de Manuela Ramos 3 años, eso fue de gran ayuda para poder surtir sus negocio.
Con este préstamo de S/. 1000.00 soles comprará 5 cajas de panetones, 10 paquetes de papel higiénico, 1 caja de aceite, 1 paquete de detergente, 1 paquete de lejía, 1 doc. De lava vajillas, ½ caja de jabón, 1 caja de leche, 1 paquete de sal, para mejorar su negocio y poder ofrecer variedad de productos a sus clientes.
La señora Mariluz ha sabido aprovechar sus préstamos de Manuela Ramos, gracias a este negocio ella puede  mantener  y educar a sus hijos.
texts.en: Mariluz is a member of the community bank named "La Flor de Canela 2", located in the district of Manatay in Ucayali. She is 38 years old and she is a single mother. She has 4 young children.  Mariluz took any job that she could until she decided to set up a small business, a small convenience store. With a great deal of dedication she has made it grow with the help of loans from Manuela Ramos (Kiva Field Partner) these past 3 years. This has been a great help to keep her store well stocked. This loan is in the amount of 1000 soles and she will use it to purchase 5 boxes of panetone bread, 10 packages of bathroom tissue, 1 box of cooking oil, 1 box of detergent, 1 box of bleach, 1 dozen bottles of dish washing liquid, half a box of soap, 1 box of milk, 1 box of salt. This will improve her business by having the ability to offer a variety of products to her clients. Mariluz has done well to invest her loans from Manuela Ramos, and it is thanks to this business that she has been able to support her children and she has kept them in school.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Serapio

texts.es: Serapio, de 53 años, es un hombre muy amable y trabajador, vive en su casa propia y siente que tiene que poner todo de su parte para poder sobresalir en la vida, ya que lo que más desea es vivir una vejez tranquila. Cuando era niño, los padres de Serapio le enseñaron todo lo que debía saber de la chacra y poco a poco a medida que pasaba el tiempo, el se fue encargando de las tierras de sus padres. Ahora tiene extensas tierras de cultivo, en las cuales cosecha cacao, café y hojas de coca, para luego venderlos en la cuidad de San Francisco. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar sus tierras, ya que es la actividad que le da de comer a su familia, lleva 25 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil, es cuidar sus productos de las plaga de insectos. Con el tiempo, desea alquilar tierras de sus vecinos, para incrementar su producción. Este es el quinto crédito con MFP, siempre ha sido muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas y espera serlo ahora también. En su banco comunal es un socio muy solidario con el resto de sus compañeras. Con los quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más abono y fertilizantes para sus cultivos.
texts.en: Serapio is 53 years old. He is a very kind and hard working person. He lives in his own home and he puts everything that's in him to be able to make it in life.  His greatest wish is to have a peaceful old age. When he was a boy Serapio's parents taught him everything that he needed to know about agriculture and with the passage of time he took on more responsibilities in managing his parents' fields. He now has extensive land to cultivate, where he sows cocoa, coffee, and coca leaves that he later harvests and sells in the city of San Francisco. What he most enjoys is cultivating the land because it is this way that he is able to feed his family. He has 25 years in the business and he considers the most difficult part of the work has to ward off insect plagues. In time he hopes to rent land from his neighbors in order to increase production. This is the fifth loan he accesses through MFP (Kiva Field Partner). He has always been on time with his payments and he hopes to continue. He is a very strong team member in his community bank. With the requested fifteen hundred nuevos soles he will purchase more fertilizer for his plantations.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: G.s Sangre De Cristo Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Sangre De Cristo está conformado por Hermenejilda y Rosa Alpina. Ambas tiene diferentes actividades económicas Rosa se dedica a la venta de frijoles y tortillas a pesar de ser una actividad muy humilde siempre está buscando la forma de salir adelante con su familia a pesar de las difíciles situaciones que ha enfrentado. Es por eso que han logrado unirse con tal de realizar mejoras para su negocio, es así que el financiamiento es para la compra de materia prima para cada uno de sus negocios.
texts.en: The group named "Sangre de Cristo" is made up of Hermenejilda and Rosa Alpina. They both have different business types. Rosa sells prepared beans and tortillas. And even though it is a very humble business she has always looked for a way to provide for her family, despite the difficult situations that she has faced. They have come together as a team with the goal of bringing some improvements to the business. This loan will be used to purchase ingredients for each of their businesses.

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Olga Luz

texts.es:
La señora Olga es socia del banco comunal Las Almendras, del Distrito de Calleria, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 34 años de edad, está casada y tiene 3 hijos.
Olga inició su negocio de venta de ropa con el primer préstamo de S/.300.00 soles que le dieron en Manuela Ramos.
Trabaja con los préstamos de Manuela desde hace 3 años y su negocio ha ido creciendo, sus ventas las realiza casi todas a crédito y con muchas facilidades, ya tiene una buena clientela.
Con este préstamo de S/. 3000.00 soles comprará mercadería en la ciudad de Lima: 5 edredones, 10 sabanas, 20 camisas,15 pantalones, 25 polos, 7 vestidos, 15 blusas, 10 shores, 10 faldas cortas, 10 bivirís, 3 paquetes de medias.
Olga ayuda mucho a su esposo con los gastos de la casa, porque él no gana mucho, se desempeña como obrero y hay días que no tiene trabajo.
Está muy contenta por tener la familia que tiene y agradece a Manuela Ramos por los préstamos que le otorgan.
texts.en: Olga is a member of the community bank named "Las Almendras". It is located in the district of Calleria in Ucayali. She is 34 years old, she is married and she has 3 children. Olga started her clothing business with the first loan of 300 soles from Manuela Ramos (Kiva Field Partner).  She has been accessing loans from Manuela Ramos for the past 3 years and her business has been growing. The sales she makes are completed almost entirely on credit or in various arrangements for the client base she has is very good. This loan of 3000 soles will be used to purchase merchandise in Lima: 5 comforters, 10 bed sheet sets, 20 shirts, 15 slacks, 25 polo shirts, 7 dresses, 15 blouses, 10 pairs of shorts, 10 short skirts, 10 tank tops, and 3 packages of tights. Olga contributes towards the household expenses with her husband. He doesn't earn very much money working as a construction worker, and there are days that he does not have work. She is very happy to have the family that she has and she is very grateful to Manuela Ramos for the loans that she has been able to access.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Socorro

texts.es: Socorro tiene 36 años de edad y es viuda hace 10 años, tiene 2 hijos Joseph de 19 y Nelly de 14 años, viven en su casa propia. La actividad principal de Socorro es dedicarse a la agricultura, en su parcela  tiene cacao, hojas de coca y café. Viene labrando la tierra hace 18 años, desde que falleció su amado esposo, ella trabaja con ayuda de los jornaleros, siendo su producto más rentable el cacao, ya que sus granos son de primera calidad y los vende a la Cooperativa Agraria, en donde es socia y percibe  al culimar el año los incentivos por entregar sus mejores granos. Con el tiempo aspira a comprar más terrenos y sembrar  cacao, para así poder sacar adelante a sus  queridos hijos. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, por lo cual ella se siente comprometida de seguir apostando por este medio, ya que le permite mejorar su calidad de vida. En su banco comunal es una socia muy respetada  por ser muy puntual en sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, adquirirá abono y  herramientas; para así poder cumplir con sus responsabilidades y mejorar la producción de sus cultivos.
texts.en: Socorro is 36 years and she has been a widow for 10 years. She has 2 children, Joseph who is 19 years old and Nelly who is 14 years old. They live in their own home. Socorro's primary business is agriculture and on her land she has cocoa, coca leaves, and coffee. She has been working the land for the last 18 years, since her beloved husband passed away. She has been getting help from migrant workers. Her most profitable product is cocoa, given that the grains are of premium quality. She sells them to an agrarian cooperative where she is a member. At the year's end she is able to collect incentives from them for having given them her best products. In time she aspires to purchase more land to sell cocoa and to be able to provide for her children. This is her third loan from MFP (Kiva Field Partner). She feels committed to keep up with these loans because they permit her to improve their quality of life. She is a much respected member of her community bank, for being always on time with her payments. The loan she requests will be used to purchase fertilizers and tools, in order to keep up with responsibilities and to improve the production of her plantations.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and tools.

loans.name: Ileana Jeanneth

texts.es: Ileana Jeanneth tiene 26 años, esta joven se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Hace más de 2 años que inicio con este medio de vida con la ayuda de su Mama que le enviaba dinero para que ella pudiera comprar la variedad de productos que ofrecía sido muy importante para ella en ofrecer a sus clientes lo que siempre le han solicitado. El crédito que solicita es para la compra de calzado, perfumes, adornos, toallas entre otras cosas.
texts.en: Ileana Jeanneth is 26 years old. This young woman has a general store. It has been more than 2 years since she started her business. In the beginning her mother used to send her money in order to purchase a variety of products to resell. It has been very important for her have the items that her clients what they request. The loan will be used to purchase shoes, perfumes, decorations, and towels, among other items.

loans.use: To use as working capital.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es: Lucia, D. 53 años, vive en su casa propia al lado D. sus tres hijos, D. los cuales solo se hace cargo D. los dos últimos, que son menores  D. edad, pues el mayor  ya trabaja y estudia. Juntos se esfuerzan cada día por salir adelante. DesD. hace 10 años,  esta emprendedora dama se dedica a la venta D. desayunos y comidas; le gusta mucho su labor, y en otros tiempos  trabajaba en distintos restaurantes. En la actualidad atienD. en su puesto D. comida, ubicado afuera D. su casa, desD. ese lugar ofrece distintas clases D. desayunos (como caldos, chicharrones, tamales) típicos del Perú. Y esta muy satisfecha pues tiene bastante acogida ya que a diario atienD. a varios comensales que vuelven a su negocio, por la exquisitez D. los platillos y los buenos precios. AtienD. sola D. lunes a viernes, y durante los fines D. semana la ayudan en la labor sus hijos. Como es una mujer emprendedora, para el futuro tiene planeado mejorar las instalaciones D. su negocio, pues quiere ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Es el segundo crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente ya que no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en su negocio. Lucia tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra D. platos, menaje y tazas nuevas que necesita para ofrecer sus platillos, pues quiere mejorar el servicio D. atención para el bienestar D. sus clientes.
texts.en: Lucia is 53 years old and she lives in her own home together with her three children but only the two youngest are dependents and still minors. The eldest of her children works and goes to school. Together they work hard each day to come out ahead. For the past 10 years this entrepreneurial woman has been selling breakfast and lunch. She enjoys her work, but she also works in various restaurants. Currently she has a food stall which is located outsiD. her home and from it she sells various breakfast foods (soups, rinds, tamales) which are typical in Peru. She is very satisfied with her business because it is very popular, various clients returning every day to sample her delicious meals and enjoy the good prices. From Monday to Friday she runs the business by herself but on the weekend she gets help from her children. She is a very entrepreneurial woman who in the future she plans on improving the set up of her business, wanting to offer better service to her clients. It is the second loan she accesses from MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and she is committed to making the payments on time, not wanting to cause trouble for those who maD. it possible for her to keep up her business. Lucia plans to invest her loan in the purchase of plates, utensils and new cups from where to serve her foods. She wants to improve the service she renders for the comfort of her clients.

loans.use: To purchase plates, utensils and cups.

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es: Luzmila, de 28 años, vive en la casa de su abuela en compañía de ella y de sus 3 hijos menores. Esta trabajadora mujer se esfuerza a diario por salir adelante. Desde hace 4 años, se desempeña como cobradora de un vehiculo de transporte público, muchas veces trabaja para su tío y otras para desconocidos, pero siempre realiza su labor con mucho empeño. Le gusta mucho su trabajo pues obtiene buenas ganancias, aunque debe estar por largas horas en el trabajo cobrando por turnos enteros, desde las 3 de la tarde hasta la medianoche, pero deja encargados a sus niños con su abuela, quien los atiende como si fueran sus hijos. Aunque a veces se siente fatigada sigue adelante trabajando para sacar adelante a sus hijos, pues como es separada, su ex esposo solo le alcanza algo de dinero, que muchas veces no le alcanza, de esta manera trabaja con mayor motivación. Y como es muy emprendedora para el futuro tiene planeado instalar una tienda de venta de ropa y calzado, pues en otras épocas ella tenía su negocio de este rubro, pero lo debió cerrar por motivos de falta de capital. Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente ya que no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Luzmila tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de panetones, y juegos pirotécnicos, pues tiene varios pedidos, y de esta manera espera obtener considerables ganancias por campaña navideña.
texts.en:
Luzmila, twenty-eight, lives in her grandmother's house with her three young children and her grandmother.  Every day, this hardworking woman makes the effort to get ahead.  For the past four years she has been a conductor on a public transport vehicle.  Much of the time she works for her uncle, and other times she works for strangers, but she always puts a great deal of effort into her work.  She really likes her job because she makes a good income, although she does have to work long hours on full shifts, from 3PM until midnight, leaving the children in the care of her grandmother, who looks after them as though they were her own.

While Luzmila feels tired sometimes, she keeps on working so her children can get ahead. She's separated, and her ex-husband gives her only so much money, and sometimes none at all, so she's highly motivated to work.  Also, being an enterprising woman, she has future plans to open up a shoe and clothing store.  She had one in the past, but she had to close it due to lack of capital.

This will be Luzmila's first loan with MFP, and she promises to make her payments on time because she doesn't want lose face with the people who made possible the investment that has allowed her to continue working in search of progress.  She plans to invest her loan in panettones and fireworks, for which she has a number of orders, so she can earn a good sum for the Christmas season.

loans.use: To buy panettones and fireworks, for the Christmas season.

loans.name: Maria Brendy

texts.en:
Maria is fifty-years old.  She lives in the village of El Portidor in the district of Las Lomas, a semi-tropical zone primarily populated by farmers and ranchers.  The majority of the population manages small fruit plantations or raises animals.  Maria owns her home (in which she appears in the photo) and she shares it with her husband and their dependent son.

Out of the front of her home, Maria operates a small general store.  She sells basic items such as food, dry goods, hygienic supplies and candy.  She attends to her loyal clients on a daily basis, seven days a week.  She is happy to be able to serve her community and improve their access to such items.  Maria’s husband is a professor who earns a consistent income that provides for the majority of the family’s expenses.

Maria plans to use the loan to expand her selection and deepen her inventory so that she can better meet the demands of her clients during the holiday season.  This will be her first loan with Kiva's partner, Edpyme Alternativa.  She hopes to be able to increase her market share and the number of clients she has by improving her inventory and service.  In this manner she expects that she will be able to solidify the business, earn additional income for the family and proviD. for a more stable future.

loans.use: To expand her selection and increase her inventory so that she can meet the demands of her clients during the holiday season

loans.name: Vilke Josue

texts.en:
Josue is twenty-seven years old.  He lives in the village of CP-5 in the district of Las Lomas in northern Peru.  It is a semi-tropical zone primarily populated by small farmers and ranchers.  Many residents own small fruit plantations and raise cattle or other smaller animals.  Josue is single and shares his home with his parents, with whom he divides economic responsibilities and work.

The family owns two hectares of land that they inherited from their parents.  Josue has the land planted with maracuya.  He has a good number of mature vines that produce fruit throughout the year.  The maracuya is a local fruit that grows numerous seeds in its interior, somewhat similar to the pomegranate.  It is quite sour but popular as a breakfast dish and with other items.  In addition to the fruit plantation, Josue raises sheep and pigs in corrals behind his home.  He raises them until they reach the appropriate size and weight and then he sells them for their meat.

This will be Josue’s first loan with Kiva's partner, Edpyme Alternativa.  He plans to use the funds to purchase additional fertilizer and other crop maintenance supplies.  He hopes this will help to improve production and his family’s living status.  Josue is a very hard working man and well respected in the village.

loans.use: Purchase additional fertilizer and other crop maintenance supplies

loans.name: Jason

texts.en:
Gameboys is a mobile video game trailer that has 8 TVs and 8 game consoles, which means 32 people can play video games at the same time. This is a great activity for parties, corporate gatherings or church events because so many people can participate at one time. Jason D. used this loan to buy two consoles and two generators.

Jason has been a serial entrepreneur since he was 11 years old when he started mowing grass for people in his community. By the time he was 18 years old, he ran a lawn care service making $600 a day, 3 days a week, “You can imagine the kind of trouble I got in”, says Jason. Jason subsequently attempted to start two other businesses which did not take off. He says, “I will be a serial entrepreneur until I’m successful and I will keep trying. I have ideas all the time.”

Jason started working for Perot Systems, which is now under Dell, as an analyst. He currently works for Dell and has recently had another entrepreneurial urge. He kept all of his landscaping materials so that when his three sons were old enough, they could start landscaping themselves. It was important to Jason that his sons learn a trade and he therefore created another business, Cowboy Irrigation. Every Saturday, Jason was teaching his kids how to irrigate, but they said, “Dad, this irrigation stuff is hard. Why can’t we do something else?” Jason told his children, “Let’s think about what you’re good at, and then let’s figure out a way to make money from that.” Out of this discussion, Jason and his kids developed the idea for Gameboys.  

Jason’s kids, Jack, Trent, Beau and Shealan, had invaluable input in designing the trailers. “This is me being a father and finding a way to be involved with my kids and teach them something that is productive. My purpose in life is to give them the best possible chance of being successful. I’ve led by example.”

Jason’s bank referred him to ACCION Texas-Louisiana and Jason was shocked by the reasonable interest rate. Jason says, “There are a lot of people out there who have great ideas. We need people and companies that will stand behind those people…. I applaud ACCION for finding avenues to trust me.”

Jason eventually would like to build these mobile video game trailers and sell them to franchises and help them set up across the country.

loans.use: 2 Consoles and 2 Generators

loans.name: Jose Cruz

texts.en:
Jose is forty-six years old.  He lives with his wife and their three children in the village of Palominos in the district of Tambogrande.  It is a semi-tropical zone primarily populated by small farmers and ranchers.  Many residents own small fruit plantations and raise cattle or other smaller animals.  The family maintains a stable and happy home.

Jose and his family raise sheep, turkeys and chickens in corrals near their home.  These animals provide meat, eggs and ongoing production.  Jose raises them up to the appropriate size and then sells them to neighbors or in the local markets.  In addition, Jose manages a hectare of land on which he has mango and lime planted.  He harvests the fruit on a regular basis given the year-round growing season in the area and sells the fruit in local markets or to local factories.

This will be Jose’s first loan with Kiva's partner, Edpyme Alternitiva.  He plans to use the loan proceeds to purchase additional feed and livestock in order to improve his business.  Since his wife supports him in that activity, he hopes to be able to maximize their production and make better use of their corrals.  He is proud to be able to earn a living independently for his family and to gain access to credit to leverage their opportunities.

loans.use: Purchase additional feed and livestock in order to improve his business

loans.name: Jose Yamil

texts.en:
Jose is twenty-two years old and lives lives in the village of Portidor in the district of Las Lomas. It is a semi-tropical zone primarily populated by small farmers and ranchers. Many residents own small fruit plantations and raise cattle or other smaller animals. Jose is single and lives with his parents.

Jose raises fowl and sheep for sale in local markets. He has corrals behind the home of his parents in which he raises turkeys, ducks and chickens. In addition to raising animals, Jose drives a mototaxi, providing transport and cargo services to his neighbors. His father owns the mototaxi.

This will be Jose’s first loan with Edpyme Alternativa. He plans to use the loan to purchase additional feed for his animals and make repairs to his corrals. He hopes these improvements will help him raise healthier animals in a shorter period of time in order to increase his income and create a more sustainable business. Jose is very hard working and has dreams of getting ahead. He appreciates the access to credit that Edpyme Alternativa is providing and the reduced interest rate that is a result of Kiva funding.

loans.use: to purchase feed and repair corrals

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen, de 31 años, vive en su casa que es propia al lado de su esposo José de 33 años, que es chofer, y sus dos pequeños hijos; juntos se esfuerzan cada día por salir adelante. Esta trabajadora mujer se dedica a la venta de diversos comestibles y productos de primera necesidad, en su tienda que esta ubicada en su casa. El tiempo le ha permitido adquirir mayor variedad de mercadería, además de buenos clientes que prefieren  comprar en su tienda de comestibles, pues la zona por donde vive es algo alejada. Le gusta mucho su labor pues le permite obtener considerables ganancias, sin descuidar su labor de madre, y por esta razón esta muy satisfecha pues ayuda a su esposo en los gastos del hogar. Así transcurren los días de Carmen que se da un tiempo para atender su negocio y también para educar a sus hijos, además como es muy emprendedora, para el futuro tiene planeado ampliar las instalaciones de su negocio pues quiere ofrecer mayor cantidad de comestibles a sus clientes. Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente ya que no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Carmen tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de mercadería en panetones, chocolates y algunos comestibles que desea ofrecer a sus clientes para la campaña navideña que se encuentra próxima.
texts.en:
Carmen, age 31, lives in her own house with her 33 year old husband, José, and their two children.  José is a driver.  Together they work hard each day to get ahead.  This hard-working woman sells various foods and basic needs items.  She sells them in her store, which is in her house.  Time has allowed her to get a greater variety of merchandise and good customers who prefer to shop at her food store.  The area where she lives is fairly remote.

She really likes her work.  It allows her to earn considerable income without neglecting her work as a mother.  That is the reason she is very satisfied.  She helps her husband with the household expenses.  Carmen’s days consist of spending some time taking care of her business and also bringing up her children.  Also, as she is very enterprising, in the future she plans to expand her business site.  She wants to offer a greater quantity of food to her customers.

This is her first loan with MFP.  She pledges to make her payments punctually.  She does not want to disappoint the people who made this help possible.  It allows her to continue working in the pursuit of progress.

Carmen plans to use the requested loan to buy merchandise like “panettones” (sweet breads typically sold at Christmas), chocolates, and some food that she wishes to offer her customers for the Christmas season, which is coming soon.

loans.use: To buy panettones, chocolates, and some food products

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen, de 18 años, vive en su casa que es propia en compañía de sus padres y hermanos menores, juntos se esfuerzan cada día por salir adelante en busca del progreso. Esta joven empezó a comercializar desde que estaba en el colegio, ahí ofrecía a sus amigas productos de belleza y también accesorios juveniles que sus amigas le pedían. Así empezó el negocio de ventas, desde entonces, no ha cesado en su constante trabajo, pues le gusta generarse sus propios ingresos y así ayudar a sus padres en los gastos del hogar. En la actualidad comercializa peluches y juguetes a sus amigas y conocidas que le realizan pedidos constantes. Como es una joven muy emprendedora para el futuro tiene muchos planes como el de instalar un negocio de venta de muñecos en algún mercado de su zona. Es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente ya que no quiere quedar mal con las personas que hicieron posible este aporte que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso. Carmen tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de cantidad de muñecos, pues necesita mercadería para aumentar sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Carmen, age 18, lives in her own house with her parents and her younger siblings.  They work hard together each day in order to get ahead in the pursuit of progress.  This young woman started to sell when she was in school.  She sold beauty products and young people’s accessories to her friends there, who ordered from her.  That is how she started her sales business.  From then on she has not stopped working constantly.

She likes generating her own income and helping her parents with the household expenses.  She currently sells stuffed animals and toys to her friends and acquaintances.  They constantly place orders with her.  As a very young entrepreneur, she has many plans for the future.   She has plans like setting up her business of selling stuffed toys in a market in her zone.

This is her first loan with MFP.  She pledges to make her payments punctually.  She does not want to disappoint the people who made this loan possible.  It will allow her to keep working in the pursuit of progress.  Carmen plans to use the loan to buy stuffed toys in bulk.  She needs merchandise in order to increase her earnings.

loans.use: To buy more stuffed toys

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy replacement parts to give better service in his shop

loans.name: Maria Gristela

texts.es:
María Gristela es una madre de familia de 51 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el distrito de Túcume, una zona agrícola que se encuentra ubicada a más de cuarenta y cinco minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace cinco años a trabajar en la venta de bebidas gaseosas y cervezas en un pequeño establecimiento ubicado en su domicilio. Ella brinda estos productos a sus clientes dándoles un trato amable, sus ventas son estables, aunque suelen incrementarse en verano. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad los utiliza para ayudar a su esposa a solventar la economía de su familia.

María desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más bebidas ya que desea contar con un stock de productos que le permita responder a la demanda que se ha empezado a incrementar debido a que el verano se acerca y las temperaturas ya empezaron a elevarse. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
María Gristela is a 51 year old mother.  She lives with her husband and their children in the Túcume district.  This is an agricultural zone that is over 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

For five years she has worked selling soft drinks and beer in a small establishment in her house.  She offers these products to her customers, and she provides them with affable service.  Her sales are stable even though they normally increase in the summer.  She uses the income she gets from this activity to help her husband pay the family expenses.

María wishes to expand her business by purchasing more drinks.  She wishes to stock up on products which will allow her to meet the demand that has started to increase.  Summer is coming, and the temperatures have already started to climb.  That is why she feels it is advisable to request a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1,000 soles.  The loan will help her meet her objective.

loans.use: To buy more drinks

loans.name: Mavila

texts.es:
Mavila tiene 47 años D. edad, es casada y resiD. junto a su esposo e hijos en el distrito agrícola D. Mochumí, una zona D. bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia D. Lambayeque, a más D. media hora D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Se dedica desD. hace un año aproximadamente a vender productos D. belleza por catálogo, ella trabaja en base a pedidos y siempre se encuentra buscando la manera D. captar nuevos clientes, ya que la empresa que le provee D. productos le paga D. acuerdo a los pedidos que realiza: a más pedidos realizados, más ganancias obtiene. Los ingresos que obtiene D. esta actividad los utiliza para ayudar a su esposo a solventar los gastos económicos D. su familia.

Mavila desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo productos por cuenta propia, D. esta manera ella contará con un stock propio que le permita satisfacer la demanda D. sus clientes rápidamente, sin necesidad D. esperar a que llegue el fin D. mes para recibir su pedido, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su meta.
texts.en:
Mavila is 47 years old and married.  She lives with her husband and children in Mochumí, an agricultural district.  The area has plenty of commercial activity, and it is in the Lambayeque province.  It is over half of an hour to the city of Chiclayo.

For approximately one year she has been selling beauty products by catalog.  She works mostly by orders, and she is always looking for the way to gain more customers.  The company that provides the products pays her according to the orders that she takes.  The more orders she takes, the more income she gets.  She uses the income from this business activity to help her husband with the family expenses.

Mavila wishes to expand her business by acquiring products on her own account.  This way she will have her own stock, which will quickly satisfy her customers’ demand.  This way they will not have to wait for the end of the month to receive their order.  That is why she believes it is advisable to request a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 500 soles.  The loan will help her achieve her goal.

loans.use: To acquire products on her own account so that she will have her own stock, which will quickly satisfy her customers’ demand

loans.name: Areli Zubiet

texts.es:
Areli tiene 29 años de edad, es soltera y reside junto a su familia en el distrito de Chepén, una zona agrícola de regular movimiento comercial que se encuentra ubicada en la región La Libertad, a más de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Ella cuenta con un establecimiento en su vivienda en donde ofrece en venta a sus clientes abarrotes, bebidas gaseosas y prendas de vestir. El negocio tiene mucha acogida debido al buen trato que brinda y a la calidad de productos que ofrece. Los ingresos que percibe de estas actividades los utiliza para solventar sus gastos personales y apoyar a su familia a salir adelante.

Areli desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo más productos de modo que pueda satisfacer la demanda que suele incrementarse durante esta temporada, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en: Areli is 29 years old and single.  She lives with her family in the district of Chepen, about an hour outside of the city of Chiclayo, which is the capital of the region called Lambayeque.  Chepen is an agricultural zone where a lot of business takes place.   Areli has set up a small shop in her home where she sells grocery items, sodas and clothing.  Her business is popular due to the good customer service and quality of items she sells.  The income she generates from this business helps cover Areli's personal expenses and also helps support her family.   She would like to purchase more items which are in demand this season.  The best way for her to grow the business is with a loan from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory for her small store.  These are items which are in demand this season and will help her grow her business.

loans.name: Elvia Jovita

texts.es:
Elvia es una madre de familia de 50 años de edad que reside junto a su familia en el distrito de Chepén, una zona agrícola de movimiento comercial considerable que se encuentra situada en la región La Libertad, a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella cuenta con una bodega instalada en su domicilio, allí ella ofrece a sus clientes diversos productos de uso diario, entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. El negocio tiene más de cinco años de antigüedad y durante este tiempo ha podido obtener una clientela estable que siempre acude a su establecimiento porque prefiere la calidad de atención que brinda y la buena calidad de productos que ofrece. Los ingresos que ella obtiene de esta actividad los utiliza para ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

Elvia desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más productos, de modo que pueda responder de mejor manera a la creciente demanda que se suele presentar durante el mes de diciembre. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en: Elvia is 50 years old and lives with her children and husband in the district of Chepen, an agricultural zone where a lot of business takes place.  Chepen is located in the region of La Libertad, about an hour outside of the the city of Chiclayo.    Elvia has set up a small store in her home.  From there, she sells a wide assortment of every day items including groceries.  She has had her business for more than 5 years.  During this time she has built a stable customer base who always return because of the good customer service they receive and the quality of the goods she sells.   The income she generates from her business helps her husband with the care and economic well being of their family.   Elvia would like to purchase more inventory, including items in demand this season.   The loan from Edpyme Alternativa will help make this possible.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory for her small store, including items which are in demand this season.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María tiene 47 años D. edad, es madre soltera, y vive con 02 hijas en una zona urbano marginal que se encuentra situada en los alrededores D. L. ciudad D. Chiclayo. Una ciudad bastante comercial, es L. capital D. L. región Lambayeque.

María se dedica a L. venta D.  abarrotes, elL. posee una bodega, L. cual viene funcionando desD. hace 03 años aproximadamente. En ese establecimiento elL. ofrece a sus clientes diversos productos D. uso diario, entre productos D. primera necesidad y abarrotes. Adicionalmente se dedica a L. crianza y venta D. patos y pavos.

ElL. desea comprar abarrotes para satisfacer L. demanda que suele aumentar debido a L. campaña naviD.ña. Para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1500 nuevos soles que invertirá específicamente en L. compra D. panetones y champagne.
texts.en: Maria is 47 years old and a single mother.  She lives with her 2 children in an urban zone located  on the outskirts of Chiclayo.  As the capital of Lambayeque, Chiclayo is a busy commercial area.   For 3 years, Maria has run a small shop where she sells grocery items and other every day necessities.  She also raises and sells ducks and turkeys for additional income.    Maria would like to purchase more inventory for her store, including items in demand during the Christmas season.  To reach her goals, she is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory for her store, including items in demand this Christmas season.

loans.name: Denys Raul

texts.es:
Denys tiene  22 años de edad, es soltero y vive  en casa de sus padres la cual se encuentra ubicada en  el distrito de Eten, un distrito comercial que se encuentra situado a media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo 
Se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros en una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado consistente en una motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina para realizar actividades de transporte) el brinda este servicio en las principales calles de su distrito y en las zonas aledañas. Trabaja durante todo el día y los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad le ayudan a solventar sus gastos personales y a apoyar al sostenimiento económico de su familia.

El continuo uso ha hecho que su vehículo empiece a sufrir algunas fallas que requieren de urgente reparación para garantizar su correcto funcionamiento, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo destinado para reparar y darle mantenimiento a su unidad motorizada, asi como compra de accesorios adicionales. Con este préstamo el podrá tener una mejor unidad de transporte, evitando posibles problemas futuros de averías.
texts.en:
Denys is 22 years old.  He is single and lives in his parents' house which is located in Eten district, a commercial district which is half an hour from the city of Chiclayo.

Denys provides a cargo and passenger transport service in a mototaxi (a motorized vehicle consisting of a motorbike with a cabin in back for transporting people or goods).  He provides this service in the main streets of his district and in neighboring areas.  He works all day and the profits that he makes from this activity help him to cover his personal expenses and support his family financially.

The continual use of his vehicle has meant that it is starting to suffer from some mechanical problems which need repairing urgently in order to guarantee the vehicle remain in good working order.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa which he will use to repair and service his vehicle as well as buy additional accessories.  This loan will enable him to have a better vehicle and avoid possible future problems with breakdowns.

loans.use: To fix his 'mototaxi' to guarantee it remains in good working order

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco tiene 41 años de edad, es soltero y no tiene hijos dependientes, reside junto a su familia en el anexo San Antonio de Padua del distrito de Lambayeque, una zona rural de pobladores bastante humildes dedicados principalmente a la agricultura y crianza de animales.

Se dedica desde hace tres años a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores. El cría ovejas en un ambiente ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio. Las alimenta de pastos naturales y cuando estas ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside.  Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad le permiten solventar sus gastos personales y ayudar a su familia al sostenimiento de su economía.

Francisco desea ampliar sus corrales y adquirir alimento balanceado, de modo que sus ovejas puedan criarse de mejor modo y pueda percibir mayores ingresos por sus ventas. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Francisco is 41 years old, single, and has no dependent children.  He lives with his family in the San Antonio de Padua annex in the district of Lambayeque, a rural area where people mostly work in agriculture and raise animals.

For more than three years, he has worked raising and selling young animals.  He raises sheep in an area located in the back part of his home.  He feeds them natural grasses and when they have reached a good level of development, he sells them to merchants that visit the area where he lives.  The income he earns from this activity meets his personal expenses and allows him to help his family financially.

Francisco would like to expand his corrals and buy balanced feed so that his sheep can develop better and he can earn more money from their sales.  To do this, he has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1500 nuevos soles.

loans.use: Expand his corrals and purchase balanced feed

loans.name: Cari Milagritos

texts.es:
Cari es una madre de familia de 20 años que reside junto a su esposo y a su menor hijo en el caserío Punto 9 de Lambayeque, una zona rural dedicada principalmente a la agricultura. Se encuentra situada a más de veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega instalada en uno de los ambientes de su domicilio. Ella suele ofrecer estos productos a los vecinos de la zona, los que siempre acuden a su establecimiento para agenciarse de productos de uso diario. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad le sirven para ayudar a su esposo, quien trabaja vendiendo pescado en las zonas aledañas, con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

Cari desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más productos de modo que pueda responder de mejor modo a la demanda que posee, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Cari is a 20 year old mother who lives with her husband and their young son in the hamlet Punto 9 in Lamayeque, a rural area where most people work in agriculture. The hamlet is more than 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. 
She sells groceries and household supplies in a store in one of the rooms of her house. She mostly sells these goods to her neighbors in the area, people who always come to her establishment to get the goods they use daily. The income she gets from this work goes to her help her husband, who works selling fish in the surrounding area, with the family expenses.
Cari wants to grow her business by buying more popular products so she can respond to demand from her customers. For this, she has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of $375.

loans.use: To increase her business by buying more popular products so she can respond to demand from her customers

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
María Elena tiene 51 años de edad, es casada y reside junto a su esposo en el sector Chepito del distrito de Mórrope, una zona que está habitada por gente humilde y trabajadora, se encuentra situada a más de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y venta de aves de corral. Ella suele criar pavos, patos y gallinas en la parte exterior de su domicilio, al aire libre, los alimenta de granos y pastos naturales. Cuando estas ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde vive. El negocio le permite ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento de los gastos familiares.

María desea adquirir alimento balanceado y más aves para ampliar su negocio y poder responder a la demanda que suele incrementarse en temporada navideña, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
María Elena is 51 years old, married, and lives with her husband in the Chepito sector of the Mórrope district, an area inhabited by humble, hardworking people. Their home is more than an hour from the city of Chiclayo.
She works raising and selling poultry. She generally raises turkeys, ducks, and chickens in the yard of her home. She feeds them grain and natural fodder. When they reach a good level of development she offers them for sale to the merchants who come to the area where she lives. This business enables her to help her husband with the family expenses. 
María wants to buy animal feed and more birds so she can grow her business and meet the demand for her goods that comes at Christmas time. For this reason, she is asking Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of $375.

loans.use: To buy nutritious bird food and more birds to grow her business and respond to the demand for her goods that comes at Christmas time.

loans.name: Celis

texts.es:
Celis es un padre de familia de 32 años de edad que vive junto a su familia en el sector San Martín del distrito de Lambayeque, una zona urbano – marginal que se encuentra ubicada a más de veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros en una mototaxi (vehículo motorizado consistente en una motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina para realizar actividades de transporte) el brinda este servicio en las principales calles de su distrito y en las zonas aledañas. Trabaja durante todo el día y los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad le ayudan a solventar sus gastos personales y a apoyar al sostenimiento económico de su familia.

El continuo uso ha hecho que su vehículo empiece a sufrir algunas fallas que requieren de urgente reparación para garantizar su correcto funcionamiento, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo destinado para reparar y darle mantenimiento a su unidad motorizada, así como compra de accesorios adicionales. Con este préstamo el podrá tener una mejor unidad de transporte, evitando posibles problemas futuros de averías.
texts.en:
Celis is a 32 year old father who lives with his family in the San Martín sector of the Lambayeque district, a marginally urban area located more than 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.
He offers a tranportation service for goods and people in a mototaxi (a motorized vehicle consisting of a motorcycle that pulls a cabin where the people or goods sit.) He offers this service in the main streets of his district and in the surrounding area. He works every day and the income that he gets helps him with his personal expenses and enables him to support his family. 
Continuous use has caused wear and tear to his vehicle, and it requires urgent repair to guarantee that it will work properly. For this reason, he is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa to repair and maintain his mototaxi, and also to buy some additional accessories. This loan will enable him to have a better vehicle and avoid future problems.

loans.use: To repair his motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Anita Antonieta

texts.es:
Anita es una madre de familia de 43 años de edad que reside junto a su familia en el sector San Martín del distrito de Lambayeque, una zona urbano – marginal que se encuentra ubicada a más de veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en general, verduras y frutas. Ella cuenta con una bodega instalada en su domicilio, su negocio cuenta con clientela fidelizada y vende tanto al crédito como al contado. Ella realiza sus compras en el mercado Moshoqueque de la ciudad de Chiclayo y a los vendedores que visitan su domicilio a venderle productos por pedido. Su esposo trabaja en el transporte de pasajeros y juntos tratan de sacar adelante la economía de su familia.

Anita desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo más mercadería de modo que pueda satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Anita is 43 years old and lives with her family in San Martin in the district of Lambayeque, an outlying urban area located about 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

She sells groceries, vegetables, and fruits.  She has a store inside her home which has a loyal clientele.  She accepts cash and also sells on credit.  She buys her merchandise at the Moshoqueque market in the city of Chiclayo and vendors also visit her home so she can order things.  Her husband transports passengers, and together they are trying to improve the economic standing of their family.  

Anita would like to expand her business by purchasing more merchandise so that she can meet the demands of her customers.  In order to do this, she has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 2000 nuevos soles.

loans.use: Purchase more merchandise in order to meet the needs of her customers

loans.name: Santos Elvira

texts.es:
Santos tiene 39 años de edad, es casada y reside junto a su esposo en el caserío La Raya del distrito de Túcume, una zona ubicada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella cría ovejas en un ambiente ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio. Las alimenta de pastos naturales y cuando estas ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside.  Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad le permiten ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

Santos desea adquirir alimento balanceado, de modo que sus ovejas puedan criarse de mejor modo y pueda percibir mayores ingresos por sus ventas. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
39 year old Santos is married and lives with her husband in the La Raya hamlet in the Túcume district, which is in the Lambayeque province, more than 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.
She raises sheep on land behind her house. She feeds them natural fodder and when they have reached a good size she sells them to the merchants who visit the area where she lives. The income that she gets from this work enables her to help her husband support the family.
Santos wants to buy animal feed so that her sheep will grow well and she will get better income from selling them. For this reason, she has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of $725.

loans.use: To buy animal feed, so that her sheep grow better and she can get better income from selling them

loans.name: Shiela

texts.en:
Shiela R. is a 27 years old and married. She supports her family through buying and selling rice and bananas as well as operating a sari-sari (general) store. Shiela lives in Pag-asa, Brgy. Port barton, San Vicente, Palawan.  

Since 2008, Shiela has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses she is gradually making her family more economically stable.  She now earns an average monthly income of 5,000 PHP. 

Shiela is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP to purchase additional store inventory. This will be her sixth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loans have all been steps in her journey toward economic freedom. Shiela aspires to improve her family’s living conditions and financial well being by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word meaning honorable). Through its alleviation program, NWTF is empowering women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Medalit

texts.es:
Medalit tiene 44 años de edad, es separada y reside junto a su familia en el distrito de Motupe, una zona agrícola conocida a nivel regional por sus festividades religiosas. Se encuentra situada a más de veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Ella cuenta con un establecimiento en su domicilio en donde brinda servicio de centro de llamadas y venta de golosinas. Este es un negocio con bastante acogida ya que ella siempre brinda un buen trato a sus clientes. Los ingresos que percibe le sirven para solventar la economía de su familia.

Medalit desea implementar su negocio con más productos de modo que pueda seguir creciendo como comerciante, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Medalit is 44 years old.  She is separated from her husband and lives with her family in Motupe district, an agricultural area known regionally for its religious festivities.  It is located twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

Medalit has an establishment in her home where she provides call center services and sells candy.  This is quite a popular business as she always provides her customers with good service.  The profits which she makes in her business help her to support her family financially.

Medalit would like to keep her business going with more products so that she can continue growing as a saleswoman.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan for 800 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To buy products to keep her call center and candy-selling business running

loans.name: Emely

texts.en:
Emely R. is a 43-year old married woman who supports her family by operating four business: she runs a general store, sells charcoal, sells fermented shrimp, and has a pig fattening businesses.  She lives in Prk. Santan, Brgy. Tampalon, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. Since 2002, Emely has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. Emely now earns an average monthly income of 30,000 PHP. 

Emely is now requesting a loan of 27,000 PHP to fund her business operations. This will be her 12th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her most recent loan of 15,000 PHP, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Emely aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way. 

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word meaning honorable). Through its alleviation program, NWTF is empowering women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: to fund business operations

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Elio

texts.es:
Elio es un padre de familia de 34 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en el caserío La Estancia, una zona rural del distrito de Olmos, en la provincia de Lambayeque, ubicado a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores agrícolas desde hace mas de cinco años, actualmente siembra maracuyá, que es una fruta muy producida en la zona, los agricultores se han venido asociando y actualmente existen diversos fundos (extensiones de terrenos agrícolas colindantes pertenecientes a diversos agricultores) especializados en el cultivo de esta fruta, esta asociación les permite conseguir desarrollar su cultivo de una manera óptima para poder obtener productos de buena calidad, así como también conseguir vender sus cosechas en el mercado a un buen precio.

Elio desea aplicarle a su cultivo fertilizantes y riegos para que la producción sea de calidad, siguiendo este objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en el mantenimiento de su cultivo de maracuyá.

El ya ha trabajado anteriormente con un préstamo financiado por el Fondo Kiva a través de Edpyme Alternativa y su producto Capital Semilla. Con el dinero de este crédito el pudo brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo y gracias a ello pudo obtener una buena cosecha. Por este motivo el se encuentra bastante agradecido con los prestamistas de Kiva.
texts.en:
Elio is a 34 year old father who lives with his wife and their children in the hamlet of La Estancia, a rural area of the Olmos district in the Lambayeque province. Their home is 2 hours from the city of Chiclayo. 
For the past 5 years, he has been doing agricultural work. He currently grow passion fruit, which is grown a lot in the area. The farmers have formed an association and there are currently several properties (neighboring parcels of agricultural land belonging to different farmers) specializing in producing this fruit. This partnership enables them to develop their crop in an optimal way and produce high quality fruit. It also enables them to sell their harvest in the market at a good price. 
Elio wants to fertilize and irrigate his land so that he will have a good quality crop. To achieve this objective, he is requesting a loan of $725 that he will use to improve his passion fruit crop.
He has previously had a loan financed by Kiva through Edpyme Alternativa and it's business, Capital Semilla. He used that loan to improve his crop, and thanks to this he was able to get a good harvest. He is grateful to the Kiva lenders for this.

loans.use: To cover the costs for growing passion fruit

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda G. is a married woman who lives in Prk. Gumamilla, Brgy. Tampalon, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by running a general store and operating a food vending business at a school compound. Her husband, Evenecer G., is 55 years old and works as a farmer to earn his living. He also helps in his wife's business activities. The couple has four children between 23 and 28 years old. 

Melinda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her previous three loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Melinda has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 7,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 20,000 PHP thus uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her fourth loan, she is borrowing 10,000 PHP to purchase more merchandise to sell to be able to continue to save for the future and meet her family’s needs.

Melinda G. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word meaning honorable). Through its alleviation program, NWTF is empowering women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: to perchase inventory

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita A. is a 49-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating two business venture: dried fish and general store  businesses.  She lives in  Brgy.Tagbino, Vallehermoso, Negros Oriental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2005 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts.  

By working hard in her dried fish vending and general store businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable.  She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 10,000.  Juanita is now borrowing PHP 15,000 so that she  can continue to  purchase more dried fish to sell.   This will be her 11th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon.  Her previous loan of Php 13,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom.  

Juanita aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the  Dungganon way.  

About NWTF:  

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.
"

loans.use: Purchase more goods and dried fish to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jenie

texts.en:
Jenie S. is a married woman who lives in Dakit, Brgy. Busogon, San Remegio, Cebu. She earns her living by operating one business venture: fishing/fish vending business. Her husband Eulito S., who is 49 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have 3 children who are 20 to 23 years old.  

Jenie joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family.  With the help of her past 4 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Jenie has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow.  Her previous loan of PHP 15,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 9,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 5th loan, she is borrowing PHP 20,000 which she intends to use to purchase fishing gear so that she can continue to save up for the future construction of her house. 

Jenie S. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF:  

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase of fishing gear

loans.name: Maria Vita

texts.en:
Maria Vita B. is a single mother who lives in Luyong Baybay, Brgy. Tacup, San Remegio, Cebu.  She earns her living by operating two business ventures: food vending and general store businesses.  She has five children who are 6 to 17 years old.  Maria Vita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family.  With the help of her past 5 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Maria Vita has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow.  

Her previous loan of PHP 14,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 7,600, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 6th loan, she is borrowing PHP 20,000 which she intends to use to purchase raw materials so that she can continue to save up for the future and the education of her children.  Maria Vita B. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.  

About NWTF:  

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.  Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials

loans.name: Miguelita

texts.en:
Miguelita D. is a 34-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating one business venture: fishing/fish vending  business.  She lives in Calma, Brgy. Malbago, Daanbantayan, Cebu.  She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2010 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts.  

By working hard in her fishing / fish Vending business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable.  She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 10,000.  Miguelita is now borrowing PHP 10,000 so that she can purchase more fishing gear and equipment. This will be her 2nd loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 3,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom.  Miguelita aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the  Dungganon way.

loans.name: Chhem(Kem)

texts.en:
Chhem S., 31 years old, is married and devoted to her three children who are students in the local public school. She is married to 35-year-old Sara Vuth who helps support the family by running a motor taxi.

Chhem currently earns an income by selling vegetable that she buys from other local farmers in the busy market in the province of Kompong Cham. She is also a rice farmer. Chhem plants her crop on the farmland that she got from her grandmother, but now it is not growing well because her farm has no watering system.

Chhem would like a loan to buy a pump for irrigation. She hopes to use the remainder of the loan to purchase fertilizer for her rice field.

Note: Chhem S. and her husband are shown in the photo.

loans.use: To buy an irrigation pump and fertilizer

loans.name: Pedra

texts.en:
Pedra B. is a married woman who has two children who are five and sixteen years old. Her husband, Virginito B., is 35 years old, works as a fisherman to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities. They live in Sitio Mahayahay within Barangay Daanlungsod, a part of Medellin municipality in the province of Cebu in the central Visayas islands.

Pedra is a fisherwoman who sells her catch herself. She joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past four loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Pedra has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 13,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 12,000 PHP, thus lifting her family's standard of living.

This time, for her fifth loan cycle she is borrowing 13,000 PHP which she intends to use to purchase more fishing tackle so that she can continue to save up for the future and business expansion. Pedra B. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through its alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a dollar a day to achieving realities beyond their dreams. They are on a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon—a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: To purchase more fishing tackle

loans.name: Yim

texts.en:
Yim N., 37, is married to Soeurn San, age 35. The couple has been married for years, and they have two children who are still learning in school.

Yim is a local rice cultivator who has been farming on her own land for many years. In addition, she raises a few ducks in a stall at their home. To improve her poultry trade, Yim N. is taking out a loan to purchase ducklings to raise and sell.

Yim N. and her husband are pictured in the accompanying photo.

loans.use: To purchase ducklings

loans.name: Ma. Elena

texts.en:
Ma. Elena O. is a married woman who lives in  Barangay Malatas, Calatrava, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures:  a general store and  a livestock business. Her husband Mario, who is 42 years old, earns a living as a carpenter and also helps with his wife's business activities.  They have 3 children who are between 17 and 20 years old.  

Ma.Elena joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1995 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 23 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Ma.Elena has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 11,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 6,000, improving the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 24th loan cycle, she is borrowing PHP 10,000 which she intends to use to buy stock for her general store.  This will allow her to continue saving up for the future expansion of her business and the education of her youngest child.  

Ma.Elena O. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.
