loans.name: Tulabing's Group

texts.en:
Harenerosa T. lives in the village of Magay, Manukan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 41 years old and leads a two-person loan group that gets funding from PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are both collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if one is delinquent or defaults.

Harenerosa is married and has two adult-aged children. She makes a living by running a sari-sari (general) store. She has been in this business for more than 7 years and earns about 2,700 PHP a month from her work.

In 2010, Herenerosa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She has successfully repaid two previous loans from PMPC, and used each of them to buy goods for her retail store. She and her loan group are applying for a new loan, for 8,000 PHP, to buy additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by her business to improve her family's living conditions.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy additional products to sell

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.en:
Vicenta Paradeo is a married woman who lives in Barangay Tagbino, Vallehermoso, Negros Oriental. She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures:  buying and selling fruit and selling Avon products.  Her husband Pepito, who is 47 years old, earns a living as a carpenter and also helps with his wife's business activities.  They have three children between 5 to 12 years old. 

Vicenta joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1999 because she aspired for something better for her family.  With the help of her past 9 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Vicenta  has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,000, improving the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 10th loan cycle, she is borrowing PHP 15,000 which she intends to use as additional working capital for fruit-selling and for livestock.  This will allow her to continue to save for the future education of her children.  Vicenta Paradeo is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.

loans.name: Pos

texts.en: Pictured is Mrs. Pos P., 41, who lives in the province of Kompong Tom, where she and her husband earn a living as rice cultivators. As the other source of the family income, Pos P.' husband drives a motorbike taxi. The couple has two children who are school age. Recently, Pos P.' husband wants to expand his business by picking up his more clients than now in order to get extra profits, but he doesn’t have a big-sized vehicle to do that. Pos P. has decided to ask for a US$500 loan to add to her saving to purchase a trailer for her husband to connect an existing motorbike so that her husband can use it to pick up more customers.

loans.use: To purchase a trailer for her husband

loans.name: Nelva

texts.en:
Nelva P. is from the village of Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 56 years old. Nelva is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Nelva owns & operates a business making and selling snacks & other delicacies like ampao, piniato, polvoron & torones de mani in the local community. Nelva has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Nelva joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nelva has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Nelva is requesting a new loan of 16,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed for making snacks like peanuts & flour. This loan will be the eighth loan taken out by Nelva from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.
